1208
The scene where Emily and Oliver are standing naked behind the car and Oliver says to her that she just "looked" (at his genital area) hadn't primarily been shot for the movie. It was actually a real moment between Amanda Peet and Ashton Kutcher which the director decided to use for the film afterwards.
tp
The scene where Emily and Oliver are standing naked behind the car and Oliver says to her that she just "looked" ( at his genital area ) hadn't primarily been shot for the movie. It was actually a real moment between Amanda Peet and Ashton Kutcher , which the director decided to use for the film afterwards.
1209
When Stony opens the door and gets stabbed and his blood sprays in Kinsa's face she screams. According to the audio commentary the effects guys weren't supposed to spray the blood into her face. She was screaming not because she just saw her boyfriend die but because the fake blood was burning her eyes
tp
When Stony opens the door and gets stabbed and his blood sprays in Kinsa's face , she screams. According to the audio commentary , the effects guys weren't supposed to spray the blood into her face. She was screaming not because she just saw her boyfriend die , but because the fake blood was burning her eyes
1210
In the locker room scene one of the players has the name Robbins on his jersey the name of director Brian Robbins.
tp

Fred Dalton Thompson turned down a key role

1212
The "so called seven dirty words" the radio executives tell Howard he can't use are based on a list invented by comedian George Carlin.
tp
The "so called seven dirty words" the radio executives tell Howard he can't use are based on a list invented by comedian George Carlin .
1213
Originally titled "Black Sheep" until it was discovered that there was already a film with that title Black Sheep. That film starred David Spade and the late Chris Farley who both co-starred with Chris Rock on Saturday Night Live. Ironically the new title "Bad Company" is also the name of a 1995 film Bad Company.
tp
Originally titled "Black Sheep" until it was discovered that there was already a film with that title , Black Sheep . That film starred David Spade and the late Chris Farley , who both co - starred with Chris Rock on Saturday Night Live . Ironically , the new title "Bad Company , " is also the name of a 1995 film , Bad Company .
1214
Second unit filming in Greenland was referred to by crew members as the "Amundsen Expedition". This was a reference to second unit director/director of photography Mitchell Amundsen and to Roald Amundsen the first man to reach the South Pole.
tp
Second unit filming in Greenland was referred to by crew members as the "Amundsen Expedition". This was a reference to second unit director / director of photography Mitchell Amundsen , and to Roald Amundsen , the first man to reach the South Pole.
1215
There was a scene later cut out portraying Aaron as a diabetic. The shot showed him giving himself an insulin injection.
tp
There was a scene later cut out portraying Aaron as a diabetic. The shot showed him giving himself an insulin injection.
1216
The use of neck signs was based on real rehab therapy techniques.
tp
The use of neck signs was based on real rehab therapy techniques.
1217
"The Fourth Kind" is a reference to scientist J. Allen Hynek's famous categories involving the sightings of UFOs. Close Encounters of the Third Kind also referred to this scale.
tp
"The Fourth Kind" is a reference to scientist J. Allen Hynek's famous categories involving the sightings of UFOs. Close Encounters of the Third Kind also referred to this scale.

Ben Affleck wears a pinkie ring and smokes with a cigarette holder in the film just as George Reeves did in real life.

1220
Many members of the cast (including River Phoenix Keanu Reeves Flea and Michael Parker) moved into director Gus Van Sant's large old house in Portland Oregon during filming. They apparently caused such a disturbance (staying up late getting drunk partying and playing music) and overtook the house to such an extent that Van Sant eventually had to move out of his own house and stay with a friend in order to get some sleep.
tp
Many members of the cast ( including River Phoenix , Keanu Reeves , Flea , and Michael Parker ) moved into director Gus Van Sant 's large old house in Portland , Oregon during filming. They apparently caused such a disturbance ( staying up late , getting drunk , partying , and playing music ) and overtook the house to such an extent that Van Sant eventually had to move out of his own house and stay with a friend in order to get some sleep.

fp

1223
The knife that Anthony Hopkins character carried in the film was made by Brian Lyttle was also used as an extra in a few scenes. Blade length was 3 3/4th inches with mammoth ivory scales.
tp

1225
Goofs Continuity: When Darryl is looking at the video Pops made with the teddy bear the angle of the camera/bear would make it seem like it was at shoulder height or higher. When Darryl finds the bear it is on a chair. That would have given the video a much lower angle.

1228
In a scene where Parker jumps into a well to take cover he lands in a number of glass bottle and cutting his arm. The bottles did have labels which were all approved to be used. When the sponsors saw what was done with the bottles they asked to have their labels removed because they were not approved as weapons. The filmmakers complied.
tp
In a scene where Parker jumps into a well to take cover , he lands in a number of glass bottle and cutting his arm. The bottles did have labels which were all approved to be used. When the sponsors saw what was done with the bottles , they asked to have their labels removed because they were not approved as weapons. The filmmakers complied.

1239

1240
In the final scene Patrick Bateman uses the phrase "Rockin' and Rollin' and whatever..." This is a phrase often used by Sean Bateman Patrick's younger brother in the book The Rules of Attraction also written by Bret Easton Ellis. Sean also makes a short appearance in the novel American Psycho where he also uses the phrase.
tp
In the final scene , Patrick Bateman uses the phrase "Rockin' and Rollin' and whatever..." This is a phrase often used by Sean Bateman , Patrick's younger brother , in the book The Rules of Attraction , also written by Bret Easton Ellis . Sean also makes a short appearance in the novel American Psycho , where he also uses the phrase.
1241
The motorcycle that Will Smith's character rides in the movie is a 2004 MV Agusta F4-SPR. It is one of only 300 produced worldwide. Its 750cc inline 4-cylinder engine produces 147 horsepower and can propel the bike in excess of 175 mph.
tp
The motorcycle that Will Smith 's character rides in the movie is a 2004 MV Agusta F4 - SPR. It is one of only 300 produced worldwide. Its 750cc , inline 4 - cylinder engine produces 147 horsepower and can propel the bike in excess of 175 mph.
1242
All angels are identically dressed except for the color of their clothes.

In the Czech Republic the movie went by the name "Heavenly Love" (a saying expressing "The greatest love possible").

The song that Andy is playing on his baritone horn while marching around his apartment is "Anchors Aweigh".

1246
The character of Sheriff Cooley fits Tommy Johnson's description of the Devil exactly: "He's white as white as you folks with empty eyes and a big hollow voice. He likes to travel around with a mean old hound." Sheriff Cooley is also a tribute to Boss Godfrey (played by Morgan Woodward) the sinister chain-gang boss in Cool Hand Luke. Like Godfrey Cooley's eyes are never seen and his mirrored sunglasses reflect his surroundings (usually fire). (In "Cool Hand Luke" Boss Godfrey is referred to as "the devil" by several of the prisoners.)
tp
The character of Sheriff Cooley fits Tommy Johnson's description of the Devil exactly : "He's white , as white as you folks , with empty eyes and a big hollow voice. He likes to travel around with a mean old hound." Sheriff Cooley is also a tribute to Boss Godfrey ( played by Morgan Woodward ), the sinister chain - gang boss in Cool Hand Luke . Like Godfrey , Cooley's eyes are never seen , and his mirrored sunglasses reflect his surroundings ( usually fire ) . ( In "Cool Hand Luke , " Boss Godfrey is referred to as "the devil" by several of the prisoners. )
1247
Jane Seymour was called in three times to audition for the role of Kathleen Cleary. Reportedly she beat out many many actresses in their fifties and early sixties also auditioning for the role of Mrs. Cleary.
tp
Jane Seymour was called in three times to audition for the role of Kathleen Cleary. Reportedly she beat out many , many actresses in their fifties and early sixties , also auditioning for the role of Mrs. Cleary.
1248
The poster for the film within the film "Coming Up Daisy" states it is based on a book by Cormac McCarthy (who really wrote the book "No Country For Old Men" which the Coens' previous film was based on) and that it was directed by Sam Raimi (a friend and collaborator of the Coens').
tp
The poster for the film within the film , "Coming Up Daisy" , states it is based on a book by Cormac McCarthy ( who really wrote the book "No Country For Old Men" , which the Coens' previous film was based on ), and that it was directed by Sam Raimi ( a friend and collaborator of the Coens' ) .

1257

1258
Several times George and other characters refer to their "invisibility" as a minority (in their cases as gay men in early 1960s American society). George is referring here to the concept of social "invisibility" of black people put forth by Ralph Ellison in his classic novel The Invisible Man which was first published about ten years before the events of this movie take place.
tp
Several times , George and other characters refer to their "invisibility" as a minority ( in their cases , as gay men in early 1960s American society ) . George is referring here to the concept of social "invisibility" of black people put forth by Ralph Ellison in his classic novel The Invisible Man , which was first published about ten years before the events of this movie take place.
1259
The filmmakers have said in interviews their story is based on a 2001 National Public Radio "All Things Considered" report about two women in the Seattle suburbs who started a biohazard removal/cleaning service. They are best friends not sisters.
tp
The filmmakers have said in interviews their story is based on a 2001 National Public Radio "All Things Considered" report about two women in the Seattle suburbs who started a biohazard removal / cleaning service. They are best friends , not sisters.
1260
The climatic touchdown that Vince Papale scores against the Giants off the fumbled punt is based on a real play. The actual play can be seen during a montage in the closing credits. However Papale was not awarded a touchdown for his effort. The referees called the play a "muff" not a fumble and thus the ball cannot be advanced beyond the drop.
tp
The climatic touchdown that Vince Papale scores against the Giants off the fumbled punt is based on a real play. The actual play can be seen during a montage in the closing credits. However , Papale was not awarded a touchdown for his effort. The referees called the play a "muff" , not a fumble , and thus the ball cannot be advanced beyond the drop.
1261
The word "fuck" and its derivatives are said 274 times throughout the film.
tp
The word "fuck" and its derivatives are said 274 times throughout the film.
1262
Michael Caine saw a lot of himself in the character of Harry Brown e.g. they're both combat veterans (Harry is a Marine who served in Northern Ireland Caine served in the British Army during the Korean war) and Caine lived in the same area that Brown does. It was things like these that drew him to the film.
tp
Michael Caine saw a lot of himself in the character of Harry Brown , e.g. they're both combat veterans ( Harry is a Marine who served in Northern Ireland , Caine served in the British Army during the Korean war ), and Caine lived in the same area that Brown does. It was things like these that drew him to the film.
1263
The Opera that Prof. Bhaer takes Jo to is "The Pearl Fishers" by Georges Bizet.
tp
The Opera that Prof. Bhaer takes Jo to is "The Pearl Fishers" by Georges Bizet .

In the dream reunion scene when Romy and Michelle are on stage to receive their award you can see just above the stage in the lights that are strung what looks like a banana on one side and a carrot on the other just like the magnets that Christie put on Michelle's back brace in high school.
tp
In the dream reunion scene , when Romy and Michelle are on stage to receive their award , you can see just above the stage in the lights that are strung what looks like a banana on one side , and a carrot on the other just like the magnets that Christie put on Michelle's back brace in high school.

The actors had no trailers make-up artists hairstylists chairs or any of the typical luxuries.
tp
The actors had no trailers , make - up artists , hairstylists , chairs or any of the typical luxuries.
1275
Liv Tyler wore shoulder pads in her bra.
tp

1276
Linda Blair was "shocked" when she discovered that Warner Bros. had used her image/voice in the promotional campaign(s) unauthorized.
tp

1277
Before the publication of The Andromeda Strain Michael Crichton had written under many pseudonyms one being Michael Douglas.
tp

1278
"Sweets to the Sweet" which is written on the walls in two areas of Cabrini Green is actually a line from Shakespeare's Hamlet.
tp

1279
Director Trademark: [Christopher Nolan] Cobb attempts to break into a flat using a credit card. The same method is used in Memento and Insomnia.
tp

1280
Reese Witherspoon Jessica Alba Jessica Biel Anne Hathaway Emily Blunt Kirsten Dunst Katie Holmes Rachel McAdams Amanda Seyfried and Lindsay Lohan were all considered for the lead role. Witherspoon turned down the role of Rebecca Bloomwood because it was too much like her "Elle Woods" role Witherspoon from Legally Blonde.
tp
Reese Witherspoon , Jessica Alba , Jessica Biel , Anne Hathaway , Emily Blunt , Kirsten Dunst , Katie Holmes , Rachel McAdams , Amanda Seyfried and Lindsay Lohan were all considered for the lead role. Witherspoon turned down the role of Rebecca Bloomwood because it was too much like her "Elle Woods" role Witherspoon from Legally Blonde .
1281
This movie is one of four movies that were sequels to films that starred Jim Carrey but did not involve Carrey in any way shape or form. The other three films are Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd Evan Almighty and Ace Ventura Jr: Pet Detective not counting Batman and Robin.
tp
This movie is one of four movies that were sequels to films that starred Jim Carrey , but did not involve Carrey in any way , shape , or form. The other three films are , Dumb and Dumberer : When Harry Met Lloyd , Evan Almighty , and Ace Ventura Jr : Pet Detective , not counting Batman and Robin.
1282
Anthony Anderson's feature film debut.
tp
Anthony Anderson's feature film debut.
1283
In the book Pilgrim is dark bay rather than chestnut and a Morgan horse. Gulliver (Judith's horse) is the chestnut.
tp
In the book , Pilgrim is dark bay , rather than chestnut , and a Morgan horse. Gulliver ( Judith's horse ) is the chestnut.
1284
Shari Springer Berman and Robert Pulcini wrote the screenplay with Scarlett Johansson in mind for the character of Annie Braddock.
tp
Shari Springer Berman and Robert Pulcini wrote the screenplay with Scarlett Johansson in mind for the character of Annie Braddock.
1285
Robot Monster which Sam Neill is watching at the end of the movie is one of director John Carpenter's favorite monster movies as a kid.
tp
Robot Monster , which Sam Neill is watching at the end of the movie , is one of director John Carpenter 's favorite monster movies as a kid.
1286
In the English subtitles several sections are purposefully translated incorrectly to preserve the humorous nature of the film. The list of strange names around Paris is changed to "Honolulu Punxsutawney Piccadilly Massachusetts Saskatoon and Machu Picchu;" and during the scene in which Wendy mispronounces "Xavier n'est pas ici..." the English subtitles say "Xavier eez not here..."
tp
In the English subtitles , several sections are purposefully translated incorrectly to preserve the humorous nature of the film. The list of strange names around Paris is changed to "Honolulu , Punxsutawney , Piccadilly , Massachusetts , Saskatoon and Machu Picchu ; " and during the scene in which Wendy mispronounces "Xavier n'est pas ici..." the English subtitles say "Xavier eez not here..."
1287
Writers Michael Crichton and Michael Backes quit the project largely over disagreement with director Philip Kaufman that one of the lead characters should be changed into an African-American.
tp
Writers Michael Crichton and Michael Backes quit the project largely over disagreement with director Philip Kaufman that one of the lead characters should be changed into an African - American.
1288
The exterior shots of the airplane that Sabrina and Linus flew in was a Gulfstream IV aircraft. It was actually the aircraft used by Gulfstream as a demonstrator taken to air shows and other publicity events. A large roman numeral IV can be seen on the tail of the aircraft.
tp
The exterior shots of the airplane that Sabrina and Linus flew in , was a Gulfstream IV aircraft. It was actually the aircraft used by Gulfstream as a demonstrator taken to air shows and other publicity events. A large roman numeral IV can be seen on the tail of the aircraft.
1289
Appearing in this film netted Tim Roth his biggest paycheck up to that date.
tp
Appearing in this film netted Tim Roth his biggest paycheck up to that date.
1290
Director Mark Waters installed a ping-pong table at both Crane Estate and Elm Bank Reservation where the present-day wedding scenes were filmed and would regularly challenge Micah Sherman Albert M. Chan and Michael Anastasia who play the groomsmen.
tp
Director Mark Waters installed a ping - pong table at both Crane Estate and Elm Bank Reservation , where the present - day wedding scenes were filmed , and would regularly challenge Micah Sherman , Albert M. Chan , and Michael Anastasia , who play the groomsmen.
1291
The spaceship that flies back to the homeworld of Remulak uses the same starfield effect for "Star Trek: The Next Generation" (1987).
tp
The spaceship that flies back to the homeworld of Remulak uses the same starfield effect for "Star Trek : The Next Generation" ( 1987 ) .
1292
Some of the young actors who claimed when they auditioned that they could play hockey were in fact lying and had to be trained before filming began.
tp
Some of the young actors who claimed when they auditioned that they could play hockey were in fact lying and had to be trained before filming began.
1293
While filming at London's Park Lane Hotel about 30 extras had to be used on short notice when the production team noticed red double-decker buses passing by frequently. That's common in London but not New York where the scene is set. The extras were used outside the hotel to block the buses.
tp
While filming at London's Park Lane Hotel , about 30 extras had to be used on short notice when the production team noticed red double - decker buses passing by frequently. That's common in London , but not New York , where the scene is set. The extras were used outside the hotel , to block the buses.

When Johnny is announcing the Hurl Scouts during Bliss' first match he mentions the team's real names. Maggie Mayhem is Peggy Smashley Simpson is Francine Rosa Sparks is Tammy and Bloody Holly is Rachel.
tp

1302
During initial test runs for filming of the external scenes sparks from the locomotives caused flash fires along the railroad. The locomotives had to be modified before filming could begin.
tp

1304
Goofs Continuity: When they are taking applications at the "lemonade stand" Crispin kicks Charlie's left ankle but when Charlie reaches down to rub his ankle he grabs his right.
fn
null
1305
Massimo Troisi was so weak that it was only possible for him to work for about an hour each day. Most of his scenes were shot in one or two takes. A shooting schedule was designed to allow the film to be shot around him. This was aided greatly by the fact his stand-in bore such a striking resemblance to Troisi. He was used for all back to camera long/medium shots and most of the bicycle riding sequences. Director Michael Radford has said that watching the film after it was cut together even he was unable to tell the difference between the two men.
fn
null
1306
Robert Downey Jr. was cast but dropped from the film because the actor's insurance premium was too costly to meet.
tp
Robert Downey Jr. was cast , but dropped from the film , because the actor's insurance premium was too costly to meet.
1307
Cameo: [Jeri Ryan and Nick Chinlund] playing a celebrity couple on the Larry King Show.
tp
Cameo : [ Jeri Ryan and Nick Chinlund ] playing a celebrity couple on the Larry King Show.
1308
The airport near the beginning of the film supposedly LaGuardia in New York is actually Washington/Dulles International Airport in Northern Virginia.
tp
The airport near the beginning of the film , supposedly LaGuardia in New York , is actually Washington / Dulles International Airport in Northern Virginia.
1309
Goofs Continuity: Although the entire movie is set and was filmed during summertime with leafy trees and lush undergrowth the additional aerial filming was obviously carried out in fall and repeatedly shows sequences with leafless vegetation and all the foliage lying on the ground.
fn
null
1310
The first two signal flags in the front of the Krusty Krab mean "Romeo" and "India" respectively while the last two mean "uniform" and "kilo". The middle flag has no meaning.
tp
The first two signal flags in the front of the Krusty Krab mean "Romeo" and "India" respectively while the last two mean "uniform" and "kilo". The middle flag has no meaning.
1311
The truck that pulls in front of Jessica as she is chasing the short school bus is hauling "Turbo Lax" the same laxative Lloyd gives Harry in the original movie.
tp
The truck that pulls in front of Jessica as she is chasing the short school bus is hauling "Turbo Lax" , the same laxative Lloyd gives Harry in the original movie.
1312
The book "The Nightmare Never Ends" by Andy Mangels can be seen on Robert Shaye's desk.
tp
The book "The Nightmare Never Ends" by Andy Mangels can be seen on Robert Shaye 's desk.
1313
3 months into filming an outbreak of Japanese encephalitis hampered the filming. Some sets had to be relocated because they were too close to pig farms (the main source transmitted by mosquitoes). All the cast and crew were given a vaccine by the set doctor and some sets were sprayed with insecticide before crew turned up to start filming.
tp
3 months into filming an outbreak of Japanese encephalitis hampered the filming. Some sets had to be relocated because they were too close to pig farms ( the main source , transmitted by mosquitoes ) . All the cast and crew were given a vaccine by the set doctor , and some sets were sprayed with insecticide before crew turned up to start filming.
1314
Director Trademark: [Guillermo del Toro] [underground areas] The subway system.
tp
Director Trademark : [ Guillermo del Toro ] [ underground areas ] The subway system.
1315
Sofia Vassilieva shaved her hair and eyebrows off in order to play the role of Kate Fitzgerald. Vassilieva described it as being the least she could do to understand Kate's pain. Due to filming in a T.V. show as well as the movie Vassilieva's long hair was turned into a wig for her.
tp
Sofia Vassilieva shaved her hair and eyebrows off in order to play the role of Kate Fitzgerald. Vassilieva described it as being the least she could do to understand Kate's pain. Due to filming in a T.V. show as well as the movie , Vassilieva's long hair was turned into a wig for her.

1319
When Estelle Getty found out that filming the movie would involve guns she said that she would only do the movie if there were no guns in it. The producers lied to her (and told her that there would be no guns in the movie) in order to get her to sign on.
tp
When Estelle Getty found out that filming the movie would involve guns , she said that she would only do the movie if there were no guns in it. The producers lied to her ( and told her that there would be no guns in the movie ) in order to get her to sign on.
1320
According to the commentary Morgan Freeman was originally considered to play the part of Charles Morritz. The part eventually went to Samuel L. Jackson.
tp

1321
Originally the role played by Wesley Snipes was offered to Sylvester Stallone but Stallone turned it down. However just for fun the script writer named one of the major characters "Sly" short for Sylvester and a nickname for Stallone.
tp
Originally , the role played by Wesley Snipes was offered to Sylvester Stallone but Stallone turned it down. However , just for fun , the script writer named one of the major characters , "Sly" , short for Sylvester and a nickname for Stallone.
1322
For the scene where Jesus and Jake play for the letter of intent the original script called for Jesus to win 15-0. However Spike Lee encouraged the actors to play for real. The scene in the film reflects the actual game between Ray Allen and Denzel Washington.
fn
null
1323
The Sony Animation technicians developed a new tool called Shapers that permitted the animators to reshape the character models allowing for stronger poses and silhouettes and subtle distortions (squash and stretch smears etc.) typical of traditional hand-drawn animation.
tp
The Sony Animation technicians developed a new tool called Shapers that permitted the animators to reshape the character models , allowing for stronger poses and silhouettes and subtle distortions ( squash and stretch , smears , etc. ) typical of traditional , hand - drawn animation.

tp

1333
The famous London costume house Angels & Bermans provided most of the costumes for the film just as they had done 45 years earlier for the Laurence Olivier version The Chronicle History of King Henry the Fift with His Battell Fought at Agincourt in France.
fp

1334
After filming this movie in Minnesota in freezing temperatures Walter Matthau was hospitalized with double pneumonia.
tp

1335
Steve Martin had Tom Hanks in mind to play Ray Porter but as the film's development progressed he felt he was better suited to play the part since he was so familiar with the work.
tp

1336
The US release of this movie was delayed for more than a year by the terrorist attacks on the USA of 11 September 2001. The producers were concerned that it would be seen as anti-American.
tp
The US release of this movie was delayed for more than a year by the terrorist attacks on the USA of 11 September 2001. The producers were concerned that it would be seen as anti - American.
1337
The match that Ewan McGregor's character sees is a real football match between two teams from Uruguay which took place in 2006. The teams are called "Nacional" (white blue and red shirt) and "Peñarol" (black and yellow shirt).
tp
The match that Ewan McGregor 's character sees is a real football match between two teams from Uruguay , which took place in 2006. The teams are called "Nacional" ( white blue and red shirt ) and "Peñarol" ( black and yellow shirt ) .

The original cut was nearly 4 hours long; over 200 hours of footage was shot.

1345
Three cameos: Tony Jaa's father appears at the Songkran scene; a Jackie Chan double in the airport intended as a tribute to Jaa's idol; and Thai rock star Sek Loso appears prominently in the foreground in one scene drinking his trademark energy drink which was tied up in a promotional relationship with the movie in Thailand.
tp
Three cameos : Tony Jaa's father appears at the Songkran scene ; a Jackie Chan double in the airport , intended as a tribute to Jaa's idol ; and Thai rock star Sek Loso appears prominently in the foreground in one scene drinking his trademark energy drink , which was tied up in a promotional relationship with the movie in Thailand.

1351

1354
Goofs Continuity: When Carter and Lucy are talking on the football field Lucy's car has only the parking lights on. A few shots later both the parking and normal headlights are turned on.
fn
null
1355
Aside from being universally panned by critics it also failed at the box office earning only over US$5 million worldwide. Because of this 20th Century Fox opted not to release the film on DVD; instead they surrendered the rights to Columbia Pictures which distributed the film outside the U.S. In addition the accompanying soundtrack CD became the weakest-selling album in Mariah Carey's career up to that point prompting Virgin Records/EMI to sever their ties with her.
tp
Aside from being universally panned by critics , it also failed at the box office , earning only over US$5 million worldwide. Because of this , 20th Century Fox opted not to release the film on DVD ; instead , they surrendered the rights to Columbia Pictures , which distributed the film outside the U.S. In addition , the accompanying soundtrack CD became the weakest - selling album in Mariah Carey 's career up to that point , prompting Virgin Records / EMI to sever their ties with her.
1356
Jeff Bridges plays a bowling President of the USA. He also plays a bowler in The Big Lebowski. Both movies also feature Sam Elliot.
tp
Jeff Bridges plays a bowling President of the USA. He also plays a bowler in The Big Lebowski . Both movies also feature Sam Elliot .
1357
A fire on the set in Nova Scotia Canada caused one million dollars damage.
tp

1360

1361
Between his audition and the start of the shoot James Clarke's hair was cut off which was a surprise to the production (11:00 in the DVD commentary). Rather than having him wear a wig it was decided that his character "Shaun" could be shorn.
tp
Between his audition and the start of the shoot , James Clarke's hair was cut off , which was a surprise to the production ( 11 : 00 in the DVD commentary ) . Rather than having him wear a wig , it was decided that his character , "Shaun" , could be shorn.
1362
The shots of the McFly concert in Times Square were actually shot in England for McFly's home-fan base. While changing lighting and camera angles McFly would play their other songs for the fans before playing the ones for the movie while filming.
tp
The shots of the McFly concert in Times Square were actually shot in England for McFly's home - fan base. While changing lighting and camera angles , McFly would play their other songs for the fans before playing the ones for the movie while filming.

1366
During the filming of the first scene many of the neighbors were protesting the film because they believed it to be a pornographic film.

1367
Derek Luke was working at the Sony Studios gift shop when he met Antwone Fisher who was working on the lot as a security guard. When Fisher's screenplay was bought by Fox Searchlight Luke asked Fisher for a copy of the script. He went to the casting director unannounced and asked to audition. He has since admitted "I was so terrible I started crying" but Luke was invited to audition again. Denzel Washington came to the gift shop to tell Luke that he got the part.
tp
Derek Luke was working at the Sony Studios gift shop when he met Antwone Fisher who was working on the lot as a security guard. When Fisher's screenplay was bought by Fox Searchlight , Luke asked Fisher for a copy of the script. He went to the casting director unannounced and asked to audition. He has since admitted "I was so terrible I started crying" but Luke was invited to audition again. Denzel Washington came to the gift shop to tell Luke that he got the part.

Claire Danes and Sarah Michelle Gellar both auditioned for the part of "Novalee Nation".
tp
Claire Danes and Sarah Michelle Gellar both auditioned for the part of "Novalee Nation".

tp
The brand of tequila they have on the Wild Wild Girls boat is Havasu Tequila. This is most visible during the body shots scene. Lake Havasu is where this was filmed.

1372
Being a WWE Film the movie was continually promoted on all WWE programming (even ECW on Syfy which is owned by WWE) weeks before and after its release to help boost sales as well as John Cena's popularity.
tp
Being a WWE Film , the movie was continually promoted on all WWE programming ( even ECW on Syfy , which is owned by WWE ) weeks before and after its release to help boost sales as well as John Cena 's popularity.

1375
Meredith Salenger plays Natalie Gann in this movie. She also played the lead in The Journey of Natty Gann when she was a child.
tp
Meredith Salenger plays Natalie Gann in this movie. She also played the lead in The Journey of Natty Gann when she was a child.
1376
Andrew Mason one of the film's producers says they hired some of the world's greatest cave divers as consultants in order to keep the movie as technically plausible as possible.
tp
Andrew Mason , one of the film's producers , says they hired some of the world's greatest cave divers as consultants in order to keep the movie as technically plausible as possible.
1377
Ice Cube says the line "Fuck The Police" a reference to his song (when he was the rapper from N.W.A. back in 1988) by the same name.
tp

Director Cameo: [Mike Judge] Factory floor worker Jim.
tp

1379
The title of the film is taken from the poem of the same name written by William Ross Wallace. The poem praises motherhood as the primary impetus for changing the world.
tp
The title of the film is taken from the poem of the same name written by William Ross Wallace. The poem praises motherhood as the primary impetus for changing the world.
1380
The sound of Matilda Dixon's wailing throughout the film is really the sound of an elderly woman's groaning in bed. The sound was both sped up in the parts where Matilda screams and slowed down in the places where she gurgles and breathes heavily.
tp
The sound of Matilda Dixon's wailing throughout the film is really the sound of an elderly woman's groaning in bed. The sound was both sped up in the parts where Matilda screams , and slowed down in the places where she gurgles and breathes heavily.

1382
Denis Leary stated that he has never seen this movie believing that his head would explode if he saw himself acting in a scene next Clint Eastwood.
tp

1383
John Cusack's character's last name Arglist translates to "guile" or "deceitfulness" in German.
tp
John Cusack 's character's last name , Arglist , translates to "guile" or "deceitfulness" in German.
1384
When Anson asks Olive out on a date he offers to bring over The Bell Jar by Sylvia Plath and Olive jokes that they could skip the book and just put their heads in the oven. On February 10 1963 poet and novelist Sylvia Plath killed herself by carbon monoxide poisoning and was found with her head in her oven. 18 September 2010 by Movie_Muse_Reviews (IL USA) – See all my reviews
fn
null
1385
The Rich mansion is the same one used in Hannibal as the home of Mason Verger
tp
The Rich mansion is the same one used in Hannibal as the home of Mason Verger
1386
German archaeologists have found evidence of the Ninth legion on the banks of the River Rhine and carbon dated them long after these events took place suggesting that rather than them being wiped out the reason that there is no evidence of them being in Scotland after these battles is that they moved to Germany.
tp
German archaeologists have found evidence of the Ninth legion on the banks of the River Rhine and carbon dated them long after these events took place suggesting that rather than them being wiped out , the reason that there is no evidence of them being in Scotland after these battles is that they moved to Germany.
1387
Joe Pesci was originally courted for the role of Jack DiNorscio.
tp
Joe Pesci was originally courted for the role of Jack DiNorscio.
1388
At the end of the movie the match commentators give the following speech: "Guards of Pentonville guards of Wandsworth Walton nick in Liverpool policemen of Britain traffic wardens and parole officers wheel clampers your boys have taken a hell of a beating today! A hell of a beating!" This speech is a direct reference to Norwegian sports commentator Bjørge Lillelien who made British headlines when in 1981 Norway beat England during the 1982 World Cup qualifiers and he gave the following emotional response: "[In Norwegian] We are the best in the world! We are the best in the world! We have beaten England 2-1 at football! It is totally incredible! We have beaten England! England home of giants: Looooord Nelson Looooord Beaverbrook Sir Winston Churchill Anthony Eden Clement Attlee Henry Cooper Lady Diana. We have beaten them all we have beaten them all! [In English] Maggie Thatcher can you hear me? [In Norwegian] Maggie Thatcher I have a message to you during the election: We have beaten England out of the World Championship in football! Maggie Thatcher as they say in your language in the boxing-bars around Madison Square Garden: [in English] Your boys took a hell of a beating! Your boys took a hell of a beating!" However despite the loss England continued on to qualify for the World Cup finals while Norway did not.
fn
null

tp

1390
Brendan Fraser is actually eating breakfast cereal when he is sharing food with the dog.
tp

1391
Originally there were a few scenes that explain more about Steve Lemme's character (Juan) - apparently he grew up on a goat farm - but they were the first to be removed from the film.
tp

1392
The studio told screenwriter Jonathan Hensleigh to remove the scenes with McClane walking around Harlem wearing a sign that says "I hate niggers." They allowed him to keep the scene when he threatened to take the script to another studio.
tp
The studio told screenwriter Jonathan Hensleigh to remove the scenes with McClane walking around Harlem wearing a sign that says , "I hate niggers." They allowed him to keep the scene when he threatened to take the script to another studio.
1393
The movie's line "Houston we have a problem." was voted as the #50 movie quote by the American Film Institute (out of 100).
tp
The movie's line "Houston , we have a problem." was voted as the # 50 movie quote by the American Film Institute ( out of 100 ) .
1394
The expression "the hurt locker" is a preexisting slang term for a situation involving trouble or pain which can be traced back to the Vietnam War. According to the movie's website it is soldier vernacular in Iraq to speak of explosions as sending you to "the hurt locker".
tp
The expression "the hurt locker" is a preexisting slang term for a situation involving trouble or pain , which can be traced back to the Vietnam War. According to the movie's website , it is soldier vernacular in Iraq to speak of explosions as sending you to "the hurt locker".
1395
Cameo: [Mateo Gil] screenwriter of Alejandro Amenábar's previous film Open Your Eyes as a dead man's photograph in the album.
tp
Cameo : [ Mateo Gil ] screenwriter of Alejandro Amenábar 's previous film Open Your Eyes , as a dead man's photograph in the album.
1396
Oscar-nominated writing team Willard Huyck and Gloria Katz began a script that would pass through the hands of writers David Koepp and Steven Zaillian before being ultimately refined by Koepp and Robert Towne. Towne kept revising the script all the way through production after Koepp left to direct The Trigger Effect.
tp
Oscar - nominated writing team Willard Huyck and Gloria Katz began a script that would pass through the hands of writers David Koepp and Steven Zaillian , before being ultimately refined by Koepp and Robert Towne . Towne kept revising the script all the way through production after Koepp left to direct The Trigger Effect .
1397
As in the movie it has been a tradition for a girl to play Peter Pan in stage productions.
tp
As in the movie , it has been a tradition for a girl to play Peter Pan in stage productions.
1398
The amusement park scenes were filmed at Wild Adventures Theme Park in Valdosta GA.
tp
The amusement park scenes were filmed at Wild Adventures Theme Park , in Valdosta , GA.
1399
In his speech at the Golden Globes Leonardo DiCaprio revealed that Michael Mann had a hand in writing the film's screenplay.
tp
In his speech at the Golden Globes , Leonardo DiCaprio revealed that Michael Mann had a hand in writing the film's screenplay.
1400
On the first day of production of Sex Lies and Videotape - Steven Soderbergh's first film - the producers of that movie sent a telegram to Soderbergh. They teased him good-naturedly telling him they'd heard reports he "couldn't direct traffic". Twelve years later Soderbergh won an Oscar - for directing "Traffic".
tp
On the first day of production of Sex , Lies , and Videotape - Steven Soderbergh 's first film - the producers of that movie sent a telegram to Soderbergh. They teased him good - naturedly , telling him they'd heard reports he "couldn't direct traffic". Twelve years later , Soderbergh won an Oscar - for directing "Traffic".

1402
The home video footage of Teri Polo during the opening credits was filmed by her ex-husband Anthony Moore.
tp

1403
The suit that Jackie buys is the same that Mia Wallace wears in Pulp Fiction.
tp

1404
During the letters montage Magda Goebbels is seen writing a letter to her son Harald Quandt (there is a picture of him in front of her) by her first husband industrialist Günther Quandt. He was her only child to survive the war. In 1944 as a Lieutenant in the Luftwaffe Quandt was injured and captured by the Allies in Italy. He was released in 1947 and later died in an air crash in 1967.
tp
During the letters montage , Magda Goebbels is seen writing a letter to her son , Harald Quandt ( there is a picture of him in front of her ), by her first husband , industrialist Günther Quandt. He was her only child to survive the war. In 1944 , as a Lieutenant in the Luftwaffe , Quandt was injured and captured by the Allies in Italy. He was released in 1947 and later died in an air crash in 1967.
1405
The music that's played during the closing scene and credits is Pietro Mascagni's Intermezzo Sinfonico from "Cavalleria Rusticana". It is also known for its appearance in Raging Bull
tp
The music that's played during the closing scene and credits is Pietro Mascagni 's Intermezzo Sinfonico from "Cavalleria Rusticana". It is also known for its appearance in Raging Bull
1406
Due to the unpredictable climate in the rain forest of Mexico special care was needed to protect the digital cameras. Under extreme heat they were covered with space blankets to reflect the heat. Temperature was closely monitored via thermometers added to the cameras. While shooting at a waterfall the cameras were protected in specially built Hydroflex splash bags designed by Pete Romano.
tp
Due to the unpredictable climate in the rain forest of Mexico , special care was needed to protect the digital cameras. Under extreme heat , they were covered with space blankets to reflect the heat. Temperature was closely monitored via thermometers added to the cameras. While shooting at a waterfall , the cameras were protected in specially built Hydroflex splash bags designed by Pete Romano .
1407
Director Trademark: [Wes Anderson] [underwater shot] In every Wes Anderson film there is a shot of one or more of the characters underwater. One person is added for each film. In Bottle Rocket we have one character Anthony underwater. In Rushmore we have a shot with two characters underwater. Then in The Royal Tenenbaums there are three people underwater. The Royal Tenenbaums also stresses the number three. When the on screen novel reads "3" it cuts to Ritchie and the narrator says that Ritichie had fed his bird 3 sardines. Then next we see Ritichie on the roof reading "3 Plays".
tp
Director Trademark : [ Wes Anderson ] [ underwater shot ] In every Wes Anderson film there is a shot of one or more of the characters underwater. One person is added for each film. In Bottle Rocket , we have one character , Anthony underwater. In Rushmore , we have a shot with two characters underwater. Then in The Royal Tenenbaums , there are three people underwater. The Royal Tenenbaums also stresses the number three. When the on screen novel reads , "3" , it cuts to Ritchie , and the narrator says , that Ritichie had fed his bird 3 sardines. Then next we see Ritichie on the roof reading "3 Plays".
1408
When Yuri finds Vitaly in the Bolivian boarding house the shape Vitaly has laid the coke in represents Ukraine the brothers' country of birth.
tp
When Yuri finds Vitaly in the Bolivian boarding house , the shape Vitaly has laid the coke in represents Ukraine , the brothers' country of birth.
1409
When Henry calls Libby to tell her Daphne has been out all day with a boy in a band (Ian) Libby says Lemme guess he's a drummer? In reality Oliver James who plays Ian is a drummer.
tp
When Henry calls Libby to tell her Daphne has been out all day with a boy in a band ( Ian ), Libby says , Lemme guess , he's a drummer? In reality , Oliver James , who plays Ian , is a drummer.
1410
Goofs Audio/visual unsynchronized: When Kazaam is singing the song "We genie" with Max if you look closely when he raps the part "...and we was in Hades 'cause we moved with the Harem of the Prince of Akabrem..." His mouth is still moving for that split second after he finishes the line but before they show Max's Face.
fn
null
1411
The initial advertising campaign for Captivity featured a multi-paneled poster. The first panel was labeled "Abduction" featuring actress Elisha Cuthbert appearing petrified her mouth covered by a black gloved hand. The second panel was labeled "Confinement" and showed Cuthbert behind a chain-link fence with a bloody thumb poking through. The third was labeled "Torture" and featured Cuthbert on her back her face hidden within a white cast and red tubes going up her nose. The fourth panel was labeled "Termination" and featured what appeared to be a limp body hanging over a table. The poster was placed on several billboards across Los Angeles causing a significant uproar and resulting in many complaints. Distributor Lionsgate - who were not involved in the film's advertising campaign and claimed to know nothing of the poster in question before the posters were distributed - and producer After Dark Films ultimately decided to remove the controversial poster from the advertising campaign and took the billboards down.
tp
The initial advertising campaign for Captivity featured a multi - paneled poster. The first panel was labeled "Abduction , " featuring actress Elisha Cuthbert appearing petrified , her mouth covered by a black gloved hand. The second panel was labeled "Confinement" and showed Cuthbert behind a chain - link fence with a bloody thumb poking through. The third was labeled "Torture" and featured Cuthbert on her back , her face hidden within a white cast and red tubes going up her nose. The fourth panel was labeled "Termination" and featured what appeared to be a limp body hanging over a table. The poster was placed on several billboards across Los Angeles , causing a significant uproar and resulting in many complaints. Distributor Lionsgate - who were not involved in the film's advertising campaign and claimed to know nothing of the poster in question before the posters were distributed - and producer After Dark Films ultimately decided to remove the controversial poster from the advertising campaign and took the billboards down.
1412
Director Cameo: [Gus Van Sant] Makes an appearance in the coffee shop scene reading a newspaper.
tp
Director Cameo : [ Gus Van Sant ] Makes an appearance in the coffee shop scene , reading a newspaper.
1413
This movie does not appear to take place in our universe nor share its time-line. Cars homes dress and furnishings sometimes appear to be from our past or present while certain technologies obviously do not yet exist in our world. Therefore it does not matter if the events take place in a present past or future. In fact no date is ever revealed nor mentioned in the movie. Even the tombstones in the graveyard scene have no birth or death dates.
tp
This movie does not appear to take place in our universe nor share its time - line. Cars , homes , dress , and furnishings sometimes appear to be from our past or present , while certain technologies , obviously , do not yet exist in our world. Therefore , it does not matter if the events take place in a present , past , or future. In fact , no date is ever revealed nor mentioned in the movie. Even the tombstones in the graveyard scene have no birth or death dates.
1414
The trailer and many photo galleries show a scene of Jean Valjean falling on his knees and tearing up his yellow passport but this does not appear in the final film.
tp
The trailer and many photo galleries show a scene of Jean Valjean falling on his knees and tearing up his yellow passport , but this does not appear in the final film.
1415
Because of the film's shooting schedule many action sequences and scenes in the film were shot by the film's Second Unit including much of the car sequence where Wesley Snipes escapes the clutches of the Asian gang that kidnapped him early that morning.
tp
Because of the film's shooting schedule , many action sequences and scenes in the film were shot by the film's Second Unit , including much of the car sequence where Wesley Snipes escapes the clutches of the Asian gang that kidnapped him early that morning.

tp

The Elvis impersonator in the early wedding scene Eddie Powers works in Las Vegas as an Elvis impersonator and does gigs at such chapels as The Silver Bell Wedding Chapel.

1426
Christina Applegate mentions to Fish during the music video shoot that she was in an all girl punk band. When in fact in real life Applegate was a founding member of the all girl group The Pussycat Dolls.
tp

1428
The film is based on the incident known as either the Laurel Canyon Murders or the Wonderland Murder Case that actually happened in the Hollywood Hills section of Los Angeles in July 1981.
tp
The film is based on the incident known as either the Laurel Canyon Murders or the Wonderland Murder Case that actually happened in the Hollywood Hills section of Los Angeles in July , 1981.

1430
"Who breaks a butterfly upon a wheel" is a quotation - sometimes misquoted with "on" in place of "upon" - from Alexander Pope's "Epistle to Dr Arbuthnot" of January 1735. The line has entered common use and has become associated with more recent figures.

The scene where they visit Ray and he is living with Rosie Perez is filmed in City Island Bronx. They drive over City Island bridge and his home is actually where they launch a fishing boat and sell bait.
tp

1435
In the arcade the game that all the young characters convince Hubert ('Jean Reno') to play is "Dance Dance Revolution". Before you see the DDR machine (it's a 5th Mix) many of the other music-related games that are shown are also part of the Bemani series including Beatmania and many others. The song that the characters play is 'Dive' by BeForU and Jean Reno's character does fail on the easiest difficulty level (Basic Mode known in more recent generations of the game as Light Mode).
tp
In the arcade , the game that all the young characters convince Hubert ( 'Jean Reno' ) to play is "Dance Dance Revolution". Before you see the DDR machine ( it's a 5th Mix ), many of the other music - related games that are shown are also part of the Bemani series , including Beatmania and many others. The song that the characters play is 'Dive' by BeForU , and Jean Reno's character does fail on the easiest difficulty level ( Basic Mode , known in more recent generations of the game as Light Mode ) .
1436
Juni's full name is Juni Rocket Racer Rebel Cortez. Rocket Racer and Rebel are the first names of Robert Rodriguez's three sons.
tp
Juni's full name is Juni Rocket Racer Rebel Cortez. Rocket , Racer , and Rebel are the first names of Robert Rodriguez 's three sons.
1437
The book "Flesh and Blood" that Jack sends to Carly has a cover that is similar to the poster for Dead Calm another Phillip Noyce film.
tp
The book "Flesh and Blood" that Jack sends to Carly has a cover that is similar to the poster for Dead Calm , another Phillip Noyce film.
1438
During the scene where the girls are on the beach checking the wave conditions the man that comes out of the water with the bloody eye was an actual surfer who got hurt. The film crew shot it and later obtained permission to use it in the film.
tp
During the scene where the girls are on the beach checking the wave conditions , the man that comes out of the water with the bloody eye was an actual surfer who got hurt. The film crew shot it and later obtained permission to use it in the film.
1439
Director Julie Taymor fought against an NC-17 rating for the film but finally agreed to make cuts in the Roman orgy scene in order to obtain an R rating. None of the gruesome violence however was considered inconsistent with an R rating.
tp
Director Julie Taymor fought against an NC - 17 rating for the film , but finally agreed to make cuts in the Roman orgy scene in order to obtain an R rating. None of the gruesome violence , however , was considered inconsistent with an R rating.
1440
The various filmmakers were asked to adhere to three guidelines: They had only 24 hours to shoot a week to edit and needed to give the sense of a particular neighborhood.
tp
The various filmmakers were asked to adhere to three guidelines : They had only 24 hours to shoot , a week to edit and needed to give the sense of a particular neighborhood.
1441
Baz Luhrmann participated in the sorts of ballroom dancing competitions shown in the movie. Stricly Ballroom began life as an improvised play featuring Luhrmann. The play was later performed at the Sydney Theatre Company.
tp
Baz Luhrmann participated in the sorts of ballroom dancing competitions shown in the movie. Stricly Ballroom began life as an improvised play , featuring Luhrmann. The play was later performed at the Sydney Theatre Company.

1443
At the time of its release in 2002 its budget of $47 million or 327000000 FRF was said to make it the costliest French film ever. However Astérix et Obélix contre César had a budget of $48 million or 274620000 FRF which supposedly made it the most expensive French film ever. Accounting for economic variances either title may earn this dubious recognition.
fn
null
1444
Goofs Factual errors: At the end of the movie Malcolm is shown taking the newly born baby out of a forward facing car seat. Babies are required to ride facing the rear until the age of 12 months.

1445
John Irving himself provided the name Simon Birch for the producers to use in place of Owen Meany.

1446
Inspired by the story of Dan Burros an American Jew who joined (and left) the American Nazi Party and then joined the United Klans of America (KKK). Burros killed himself when a journalist revealed his heritage in The New York Times.
tp
Inspired by the story of Dan Burros , an American Jew , who joined ( and left ) the American Nazi Party , and then joined the United Klans of America ( KKK ) . Burros killed himself when a journalist revealed his heritage in The New York Times.

Co-star Robert Pastorelli accidentally blurted out the big plot twist during an appearance on Late Night with David Letterman long before the film was released.
tp

1456
Goofs Continuity: In the scene at Amy's apartment Oscar serves champagne in two glasses: one green and one crystaline. When Amy gets out of the shower Oscar hands her the green glass. But in the next shot when Amy and Oscar make a toast and lift their glasses the glasses have been switched: Oscar holds the green glass and Amy the crystaline one.
fn
null
1457
The 2001 Game Boy Advance game "Ecks vs. Sever" was actually based on an early script draft for this film and not the other way around. The game's producers later made a sequel to that game that was based on the finished version of the movie.
tp
The 2001 Game Boy Advance game "Ecks vs. Sever" was actually based on an early script draft for this film and not the other way around. The game's producers later made a sequel to that game that was based on the finished version of the movie.
1458
Despite Mike Leigh's reputation the film budget was so tight that during the penultimate week they ran out of money so Leigh and the cast rehearsed for a further week before carrying on.
tp
Despite Mike Leigh 's reputation , the film budget was so tight that during the penultimate week , they ran out of money , so Leigh and the cast rehearsed for a further week before carrying on.
1459
Goofs Continuity: When Nick is in the hospital after the first crash he goes into a convulsion and the nurse runs in and hits the button and announces a "code blue". That should get every available doctor and nurse in the area to run into the room. Then the mother says he's alright now yet the nurse never calls to reverse the code blue and no-one shows up.

1460
The raindrops outside the news stand look like sperm cells.
tp

1461
During production planning for this film the studio contacted American Airlines to request information about its "CARE Team" in order to portray the movie airline's response team more accurately. American declined seeing no upside in being associated with a film about a crash.
tp
During production planning for this film , the studio contacted American Airlines to request information about its "CARE Team" in order to portray the movie airline's response team more accurately. American declined , seeing no upside in being associated with a film about a crash.
1462
When Seth Green is in the plane drinking coffee you see him wince a little - not because the coffee is hot - but because Vin Diesel had put his cigarette out in the coffee prior to the filming of that scene
tp
When Seth Green is in the plane drinking coffee , you see him wince a little - not because the coffee is hot - but because Vin Diesel had put his cigarette out in the coffee , prior to the filming of that scene
1463
During the hospital scene where Ripley confronts the Sheriff about the classroom incident we hear a voice on the intercom paging "Dr. Tarantini" "Dr. McGreal" "Dr. Cain" and "Dr. Grodnik". Tom Tarantini and Sean Cain are both actors in the film Mimi N. McGreal is a production assistant and Daniel Grodnik is the film's producer.
tp
During the hospital scene where Ripley confronts the Sheriff about the classroom incident , we hear a voice on the intercom paging "Dr. Tarantini" , "Dr. McGreal" , "Dr. Cain" and "Dr. Grodnik". Tom Tarantini and Sean Cain are both actors in the film , Mimi N. McGreal is a production assistant , and Daniel Grodnik is the film's producer.
1464
According to Bruce Beresford in a book he wrote Steven Seagal asked for a supporting role but was declined.
tp
According to Bruce Beresford in a book he wrote , Steven Seagal asked for a supporting role but was declined.
1465
Velma's nameplate necklace reads 'Velmalicious'
tp
Velma's nameplate necklace reads 'Velmalicious'
1466
The film was originally to be called "Killing Mrs. Tingle". The events on 20 April 1999 at Columbine High School (Littleton Colorado USA) in which 13 people were murdered by two of their own classmates prompted the name change.
tp
The film was originally to be called "Killing Mrs. Tingle". The events on 20 April 1999 at Columbine High School ( Littleton , Colorado , USA ) in which 13 people were murdered by two of their own classmates , prompted the name change.
1467
In a bit of truly inspired foreshadowing in 1993 2 years before this films release Christopher Walken played an eerily similar role to that of his portrayal of the Archangel Gabriel in The Prophecy. In the Madonna video for the song "Bad Girl" (from her album "Erotica") Walken plays the Angel of Death who silently follows a woman (Madonna) as she is being destroyed by her lifestyle. Though there is no speaking part his mannerisms and look are strikingly similar to his later depiction of Gabriel - even down to his slicked back hair pale complexion and mostly black wardrobe.
tp
In a bit of truly inspired foreshadowing , in 1993 , 2 years before this films release , Christopher Walken played an eerily similar role to that of his portrayal of the Archangel Gabriel in The Prophecy. In the Madonna video for the song "Bad Girl" ( from her album "Erotica" ), Walken plays the Angel of Death who silently follows a woman ( Madonna ) as she is being destroyed by her lifestyle. Though there is no speaking part , his mannerisms and look are strikingly similar to his later depiction of Gabriel - even down to his slicked back hair , pale complexion and mostly black wardrobe.

Rob Reiner played the part of Stan simply because he was the cheapest actor he could find.

Noted artist Samir Mondal made three paintings for Aamir Khan for this film and did not charge anything for them. His works normally sell in the range of Rs. 100000 to 700000 depending on the size of the painting.

Large selections of Peter Coyote's wardrobe were supplied by Parisian luxury clothing company Cerruti 1881.

1474
Director Trademark: [John Woo] (Two Guns): In this case it was two swords as the movie takes place in 208 A.D. Zhou Yu and Prime Minister Cao Cao each hold a sword to the others throat in John Woo's trademark "Mexican Standoff" image.
tp
Director Trademark : [ John Woo ] ( Two Guns ): In this case , it was two swords , as the movie takes place in 208 A.D. Zhou Yu and Prime Minister Cao Cao each hold a sword to the others throat in John Woo's trademark "Mexican Standoff" image.
1475
Due to a strong friendship formed between the two actors on the set of Bloodsport Jean-Claude Van Damme wanted no one but Bolo Yeung to play the lead villain in this movie.
tp
Due to a strong friendship formed between the two actors on the set of Bloodsport , Jean - Claude Van Damme wanted no one but Bolo Yeung to play the lead villain in this movie.
1476
Director Trademark: [Woody Allen] [credits] opening credits are simple white typeface on black set to early period music.
tp

1477
The coordinates given for Nim's Island (20 degrees south 160 degrees west) puts it in the dead center of the Cook Islands Archipelago.
tp
The coordinates given for Nim's Island ( 20 degrees south , 160 degrees west ) puts it in the dead center of the Cook Islands Archipelago.
1478
Students who attended a school in which a few scenes of the movie were shot were cast as extras.
tp

1479
While filming courtroom scenes the location was hit by the 6.7 Northridge California earthquake. Kevin Bacon was handcuffed to a large table he took refuge underneath while an enormous crystal chandelier swung overhead. The warehouse studio was later condemned.
tp
While filming courtroom scenes , the location was hit by the 6.7 Northridge , California , earthquake. Kevin Bacon was handcuffed to a large table , he took refuge underneath , while an enormous crystal chandelier swung overhead. The warehouse studio was later condemned.
1480
FBI Agent Mathis is played by Mark Polish who wrote the screenplay.
tp
FBI Agent Mathis is played by Mark Polish , who wrote the screenplay.

DVD commentary is done by Luke Dawson (screenplay) Alex Sundell (production executive) and Rachael Taylor.

1482
Josefine Cronholm's version of Burt Bacharach's classic song "Close to You" performed in the film during the scene where Helena is dressed by mechanical handmaidens was inspired by composer Wayne Horvitz's 1997 cover version of the song featured in the tribute album "Great Jewish Music: Burt Bacharach" (sung by Julie Wolf and Robin Holcomb).
tp
Josefine Cronholm 's version of Burt Bacharach 's classic song "Close to You" , performed in the film during the scene where Helena is dressed by mechanical handmaidens , was inspired by composer Wayne Horvitz 's 1997 cover version of the song featured in the tribute album "Great Jewish Music : Burt Bacharach" ( sung by Julie Wolf and Robin Holcomb ) .
1483
Shot at the Mediterranean Studios in Malta the same studio where Raise the Titanic Popeye and Orca were also shot all - like Cutthroat Island - box office bombs.
tp
Shot at the Mediterranean Studios in Malta , the same studio where Raise the Titanic , Popeye and Orca were also shot , all - like Cutthroat Island - box office bombs.
1484
The Ducks that appeared in the first film but did not return for this sequel are; Dave Karp (Aaron Schwartz) Peter Mark (J.D. Daniels) Terry Hall (Jussie Smollett} Tammy Duncan (Jane Plank) and Tommy Duncan (Danny Tamberelli).
tp
The Ducks that appeared in the first film but did not return for this sequel are ; Dave Karp ( Aaron Schwartz ), Peter Mark ( J.D. Daniels ), Terry Hall ( Jussie Smollett }, Tammy Duncan ( Jane Plank ), and Tommy Duncan ( Danny Tamberelli ) .

Rick Yune was originally cast as Gen but he was replaced by Robin Shou who played Liu Kang in Mortal Kombat and Mortal Kombat: Annihilation.
tp
Rick Yune was originally cast as Gen , but he was replaced by Robin Shou , who played Liu Kang in Mortal Kombat and Mortal Kombat : Annihilation .

1490
Was released theatrically despite the previous sequels having been made-for-TV - a rarity for sequels. Many film series have gotten out of direct to video or made for TV through remakes but few series get out of made-for-TV status otherwise.
tp
Was released theatrically despite the previous sequels having been made - for - TV - a rarity for sequels. Many film series have gotten out of direct to video or made for TV through remakes , but few series get out of made - for - TV status otherwise.
1491
Rod Lurie's previous film Resurrecting the Champ also dealt with a journalist seeking a big story and trying to get the Pulitzer Prize. Both films were also influenced by true events.
tp

1492
Mark Feuerstein had been in talks to play Cal Cooper but Christian Kane ended up playing him.
tp

1493
F. Murray Abraham's contract for this movie stipulated that his name appear above the title in the advertising or not at all. Since the producers already had Tom Hanks Melanie Griffith 'Bruce Willis (I)' and Morgan Freeman above the title Abraham chose not to be credited.
tp
F. Murray Abraham 's contract for this movie stipulated that his name appear above the title in the advertising , or not at all. Since the producers already had Tom Hanks , Melanie Griffith , 'Bruce Willis ( I ) ' and Morgan Freeman above the title , Abraham chose not to be credited.
1494
When Kirstie Alley is working as a mall elf she says to a girl waiting in line "No I'm a Vulcan." This is an obvious reference to her memorable movie debut as Lt.Saavik in Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan.
tp
When Kirstie Alley is working as a mall elf , she says to a girl waiting in line "No , I'm a Vulcan." This is an obvious reference to her memorable movie debut as Lt.Saavik in Star Trek II : The Wrath of Khan .
1495
The film is set in Miami but was filmed entirely in Queensland.

1497
Edward Asner was going to play Dr. Herman Cromwell but dropped out.
tp

1498
The death of David Crockett as depicted in this film is corroborated by the account of a Mexican soldier Jose Enrique de la Pena. Though not translated into English until after the earlier Alamo film was made his account makes the claim that Crockett was recognized by the Mexicans and was executed after the battle rather than killed during it.
tp
The death of David Crockett as depicted in this film is corroborated by the account of a Mexican soldier , Jose Enrique de la Pena. Though not translated into English until after the earlier Alamo film was made , his account makes the claim that Crockett was recognized by the Mexicans , and was executed after the battle rather than killed during it.
1499
Florence Henderson who played Carol in the original The Brady Bunch appears as Grandma.
tp
Florence Henderson , who played Carol in the original The Brady Bunch , appears as Grandma.
1500
The wife of the man Tiffany calls to apologize to is the widow of the cop she killed at the beginning of Bride of Chucky.
tp
The wife of the man Tiffany calls to apologize to is the widow of the cop she killed at the beginning of Bride of Chucky .
1501
An interracial aspect of the film was originally planned according to the director in an interview. However this idea was scrapped presumably because of similarities to screenwriter David Loughery's previous film Lakeview Terrace.
tp
An interracial aspect of the film was originally planned according to the director in an interview. However , this idea was scrapped , presumably because of similarities to screenwriter David Loughery 's previous film , Lakeview Terrace .

The "Coke" Ferris wheel shown in the movie is located on the island of Okinawa Japan in a shopping and entertainment district called "American Village".
tp
The "Coke" Ferris wheel shown in the movie is located on the island of Okinawa Japan in a shopping and entertainment district called "American Village".

1508
The "Golf Marathon" wager is based on an real-life proposition bet involving professional poker player Huck Seed. Seed actually won the bet.

1509
The three poems we see Lucy (Liv Tyler) compose while in Italy are: - 1. I have her secret deep within for years I've had to hide I've bought the clues And now I'm hope To bring the truth outside - 2. I wait I wait so patiently I'm as quiet as a cup I hope you'll come and rattle me Quick! Come wake me up. - 3. The dye is cast The dice are rolled I feel like shit you look like gold.
tp
The three poems we see Lucy ( Liv Tyler ) compose while in Italy are : - 1. I have her secret deep within for years I've had to hide I've bought the clues And now I'm hope To bring the truth outside - 2. I wait I wait so patiently I'm as quiet as a cup I hope you'll come and rattle me Quick! Come wake me up. - 3. The dye is cast The dice are rolled I feel like shit you look like gold.

1511
Mick Jones of The Clash sings the Clash song "Should I Stay Or Should I Go" in the karaoke-esque club scene but he appears to get the words wrong. The song goes "If I go there will be trouble. If I STAY it will be double" but he sings "If I go there will be trouble. If I GO it will be double".
tp
Mick Jones of The Clash sings the Clash song "Should I Stay Or Should I Go" in the karaoke - esque club scene , but he appears to get the words wrong. The song goes "If I go there will be trouble. If I STAY it will be double" , but he sings "If I go there will be trouble. If I GO it will be double".
1512
The "super control fire elevator" board is actually a 2400 baud internal modem without the mounting brace.
tp

1515
Ed Harris's father bought his son a book about Jackson Pollock simply because he felt Ed bore a strong resemblance to the painter. Ever since then Ed Harris became fascinated with Pollock's life.
tp
Ed Harris 's father bought his son a book about Jackson Pollock simply because he felt Ed bore a strong resemblance to the painter. Ever since then , Ed Harris became fascinated with Pollock's life.
1516
Salma Hayek has a real fear of snakes and had always refused to be near them. Naturally when she read the script she knew her phobia would prevent her from taking the part. Robert Rodriguez conned her into thinking that Madonna was ready to nab the part instead so Hayek spent two months with therapists to overcome her fear.
tp
Salma Hayek has a real fear of snakes and had always refused to be near them. Naturally when she read the script , she knew her phobia would prevent her from taking the part. Robert Rodriguez conned her into thinking that Madonna was ready to nab the part instead so Hayek spent two months with therapists to overcome her fear.
1517
The painting on the wall behind Avner in the "safe-house" scene is 'Children Eating Grapes and a Melon' by Bartolomé Esteban Murillo. The painting currently resides in Alte Pinakothek Munich.
tp
The painting on the wall , behind Avner , in the "safe - house" scene is 'Children Eating Grapes and a Melon' by Bartolomé Esteban Murillo. The painting currently resides in Alte Pinakothek , Munich.
1518
The title refers to the end-date of the current (13th) b'ak'tun of the Long Count calendar used by the Mayan Meso-American civilization. In their creation myth we live in the fourth "attempt" at creating the world while the third attempt was dismissed as a failure after its own 13th b'ak'tun. Though Mayan documents contain no such information popular culture and certain religions predict an apocalyptic event at this date. It is popularly misunderstood that the calendar "ends" on this date however the Long Count calendar can express dates from approximately 3000BC (their date for the creation of the current world) to approximately 40 octillion years in the future. It is almost impossible to express this date in a mortally comprehensible fashion.
tp
The title refers to the end - date of the current ( 13th ) b'ak'tun of the Long Count calendar , used by the Mayan Meso - American civilization. In their creation myth , we live in the fourth "attempt" at creating the world , while the third attempt was dismissed as a failure after its own 13th b'ak'tun. Though Mayan documents contain no such information , popular culture and certain religions predict an apocalyptic event at this date. It is popularly misunderstood that the calendar "ends" on this date , however the Long Count calendar can express dates from approximately 3000BC ( their date for the creation of the current world ) to approximately 40 octillion years in the future. It is almost impossible to express this date in a mortally comprehensible fashion.
1519
In a deleted scene Tom dreams of shooting Carl Fogarty in the diner but the scene was cut because David Cronenberg thought it was too reminiscent of the director's own previous Videodrome. In the scene Fogarty his chest blown open by a shotgun the exposed ends of ribs smoking nonetheless rises from the floor and aims a handgun at Tom. Along with the deleted scene the director and crew joke that Fogarty should pull the gun out of his gaping abdomen an "homage" by the director to himself and to "Videodrome".
tp
In a deleted scene , Tom dreams of shooting Carl Fogarty in the diner , but the scene was cut because David Cronenberg thought it was too reminiscent of the director's own previous Videodrome . In the scene , Fogarty , his chest blown open by a shotgun , the exposed ends of ribs smoking , nonetheless rises from the floor and aims a handgun at Tom. Along with the deleted scene , the director and crew joke that Fogarty should pull the gun out of his gaping abdomen , an "homage" by the director to himself and to "Videodrome".
1520
On the side walls of Beeman's bowling alley there is a logo of three balls each having a line that juts off from them looking more like [666] than anything. This can be seen at the beginning of the scene where Beeman discovers the truth to the demons trying to pass over.
tp
On the side walls of Beeman's bowling alley there is a logo of three balls each having a line that juts off from them , looking more like [ 666 ] than anything. This can be seen at the beginning of the scene where Beeman discovers the truth to the demons trying to pass over.

1522

tp

1523
There are 23 people in the street fight.
tp
There are 23 people in the street fight.
1524
Screenwriter Robert Rodat called the final battle a hybrid between the Battle of Guilford Courthouse and the Battle of Cowpens: The mixture of militia and Continental army in the battle. The militia's reputation of not holding and the tactic of using that to lure the British in. The militia only firing a couple of volleys before a planned retreat to a secondary line composed of the Continental army. The Continental army firing and then performing a bayonet charge.
tp
Screenwriter Robert Rodat called the final battle a hybrid between the Battle of Guilford Courthouse and the Battle of Cowpens : The mixture of militia and Continental army in the battle. The militia's reputation of not holding and the tactic of using that to lure the British in. The militia only firing a couple of volleys before a planned retreat to a secondary line composed of the Continental army. The Continental army firing and then performing a bayonet charge.
1525
Ben Affleck took a part in this film to be near then-girlfriend Gwyneth Paltrow.
tp
Ben Affleck took a part in this film to be near then - girlfriend , Gwyneth Paltrow .
1526
For the first time in cinematic history the production shut down Hollywood Boulevard and Highland for seven days for the shooting according to director F. Gary Gray in an interview featured in the DVD.
tp
For the first time in cinematic history , the production shut down Hollywood Boulevard and Highland for seven days for the shooting , according to director F. Gary Gray in an interview featured in the DVD.
1527
According to the DVD commentary the writer estimates that 75% of the film actually happened to him.
tp
According to the DVD commentary , the writer estimates that 75% of the film actually happened to him.
1528
The poster which reads "Information the key to Prosperity / Ministry of Information" (at about 12:00) is a reference to Soviet 1923 advertisement poster "Rezinotrest" made by Vladimir Mayakovsky. The movie poster uses the same colors and style (half of word "Prosperity" green half red similar to word "Rezinotrest" on the original poster).
tp
The poster which reads "Information the key to Prosperity / Ministry of Information" ( at about 12 : 00 ) is a reference to Soviet 1923 advertisement poster "Rezinotrest" made by Vladimir Mayakovsky. The movie poster uses the same colors and style ( half of word "Prosperity" green , half red , similar to word "Rezinotrest" on the original poster ) .
1529
The T-Shirt that promotes "Norman's Rare Guitars" worn by Jason Segel's songwriter character in many Hawaiian scenes is from a real store frequented by rock stars and musicians in Tarzana California. 11 April 2008 by orrell-3 (Los Angeles California) – See all my reviews
fp
The T - Shirt that promotes "Norman's Rare Guitars" , worn by Jason Segel 's songwriter character in many Hawaiian scenes , is from a real store frequented by rock stars and musicians in Tarzana , California.

1533

1534
The literal translation of the German title is "The Warrior and the Empress". The name of the main female character "Sissi" refers to the nickname of Elisabeth Empress of Austria and Queen of Hungary (1837-1898). There are several movies and television shows about the Empress Elisabeth some with "Sissi' in the title.
tp
The literal translation of the German title is "The Warrior and the Empress". The name of the main female character , "Sissi" , refers to the nickname of Elisabeth , Empress of Austria and Queen of Hungary ( 1837 - 1898 ) . There are several movies and television shows about the Empress Elisabeth , some with "Sissi' in the title.
1535
The 'Russell' that is being referred to into the rack track scene is Russell Baze the most successful jockey in the history of Thoroughbred horse racing and a member of the United States Racing Hall of Fame.
tp
The 'Russell' that is being referred to into the rack track scene is Russell Baze , the most successful jockey in the history of Thoroughbred horse racing , and a member of the United States Racing Hall of Fame.

1544
Goofs Errors made by characters (possibly deliberate errors by the filmmakers): When Charlotte is ice skating Will says "The judges give it a 10! A perfect 10!" In the sport of figure skating a perfect score is 6.0 - gymnastics is the sport where 10 is a perfect score.

1546
Dorian Newberry has a copy of "Slaughterhouse 5" by Kurt Vonnegut in his pocket. In Vonnegut's short story "Harrison Bergeron" the plot involves mind control in the form of head bands to obtain equality.
