1548
In the film Dennis says to Berke "Who marries their high-school girlfriend anyway?" with Felix adding "And don't say Macaulay Culkin!" Ironic considering their costar Mila Kunis (Basin) started a long-term romance with Culkin a year after this film was released.
tp
In the film , Dennis says to Berke "Who marries their high - school girlfriend anyway?" with Felix adding "And don't say Macaulay Culkin !" Ironic considering their costar Mila Kunis ( Basin ) started a long - term romance with Culkin a year after this film was released.

Wes Craven was inspired to write this film after seeing a real-life news story about parents who locked their children up inside their house never allowing them outside.

1553
The books being burned at the end of the movie are surplus copies of 'Knife of Dreams' the eleventh novel in Robert Jordan's Wheel of Time series. The series logo and gate-fold map are clearly visible in one shot.
tp
The books being burned at the end of the movie are surplus copies of 'Knife of Dreams' , the eleventh novel in Robert Jordan's Wheel of Time series. The series logo and gate - fold map are clearly visible in one shot.

1555
Several bits from the trailer do not appear in the finished film. These include Nancy pulling a gun on Jack (and the resulting dialog of her asking "What kind of girl do you think I am?" with Jack replying "The kind of girl who had a gun on me thirty seconds ago" and Nancy saying "Yeah but I didn't SHOOT you..."); Nancy and Jack actually getting into the car as they steal it (she playfully says "Let's make out!" and Jack replies "Eaaasy..."); a couple shots of Jack and Nancy kissing; Jack and Nancy on a skateboard; and finally Jack making a playful growling sound.
tp
Several bits from the trailer do not appear in the finished film. These include Nancy pulling a gun on Jack ( and the resulting dialog of her asking , "What kind of girl do you think I am?" with Jack replying , "The kind of girl who had a gun on me thirty seconds ago , " and Nancy saying "Yeah , but I didn't SHOOT you..." ); Nancy and Jack actually getting into the car as they steal it ( she playfully says , "Let's make out!" and Jack replies , "Eaaasy..." ); a couple shots of Jack and Nancy kissing ; Jack and Nancy on a skateboard ; and finally Jack making a playful growling sound.
1556
Just before the birthday scene when Ramu arrives at Lexi's house we hear the party planner greet a couple as Mr. and Mrs. de Borman. John de Borman is the movie's director of photography.
tp
Just before the birthday scene when Ramu arrives at Lexi's house we hear the party planner greet a couple as Mr. and Mrs. de Borman. John de Borman is the movie's director of photography.

1558
The cast includes at least six active WWE wrestlers: Dalip Singh ("The Great Khali") Glen Jacobs ("Kane") Paul Wight ("The Big Show") Mark Henry and Chris Jericho and Antonio Banks aka MVP.

1559
Taj's last name Badalandabad in Hindi slang translates to "land where people have big penises"

1562
At the beginning of the film when Birdee and Bernice are leaving Chicago to stay with her mother in Texas the two are driving on a freeway. They pass a bus with a billboard on the side advertising for the television show Birdie was just dumped on. The billboard reads: "Toni: She'll change your life!"
tp
At the beginning of the film , when Birdee and Bernice are leaving Chicago to stay with her mother in Texas , the two are driving on a freeway. They pass a bus with a billboard on the side advertising for the television show Birdie was just dumped on. The billboard reads : "Toni : She'll change your life!"
1563
In the original short story by P. K. Dick the plot takes place on Earth instead of Sirius 6B. Originally Screamers were designed by Americans troops hiding in the moon to destroy the Russian Army after the Soviet Union had completely wiped out the United States.
tp
In the original short story by P. K. Dick the plot takes place on Earth , instead of Sirius 6B. Originally , Screamers were designed by Americans troops hiding in the moon to destroy the Russian Army after the Soviet Union had completely wiped out the United States.
1564
It is impossible to actually steal a copy of the SAT's because there are several versions. Everyone who takes it has different questions or the questions are in a different order.
tp
It is impossible to actually steal a copy of the SAT's because there are several versions. Everyone who takes it has different questions or the questions are in a different order.
1565
Only 5 American actors appear in the film - Emma Roberts JoJo Sara Paxton Arielle Kebbel and Jake McDorman. The rest of the cast are all Australian.
tp

Steve Coogan is also doing the narration.

1567
In the original script when Nick Chen walks in on Henry Vu being fed grapes in the bath she was supposed to be giving him oral sex. Yun-Fat Chow said that Chen would not continue a relationship with May after witnessing this act and the grape-feeding was suggested.
tp

1568

1569
The school scenes were filmed at The Grey Coat Hospital school in Westminster London which is actually a girls school.
tp

1570
Despite the fact that this was filmed in Super 35 "Filmed in Panavision" is listed in the end credits.
tp

1571
Filming only cost $500000 while the digital effects cost an additional $10 million.
tp
Filming only cost $500 , 000 , while the digital effects cost an additional $10 million.
1572
Baker's inability to throw the ball back to the pitcher was based on former New York Mets catcher Mackey Sasser. Sasser was very successful at throwing out runners attempting to steal second but had a mental block causing him to flinch several times when trying to throw the ball back to the pitcher. Many baserunners took advantage of this affliction and stole bases while he was triple pumping his throw and/or lollipopping the throw back.
tp
Baker's inability to throw the ball back to the pitcher was based on former New York Mets catcher Mackey Sasser. Sasser was very successful at throwing out runners attempting to steal second , but had a mental block causing him to flinch several times when trying to throw the ball back to the pitcher. Many baserunners took advantage of this affliction and stole bases while he was triple pumping his throw , and / or lollipopping the throw back.
1573
When Mrs. Henderson is in bed talking to Lady Conway by telephone we see it as a split screen. Stephen Frears achieved this by filming them simultaneously side by side.
tp
When Mrs. Henderson is in bed talking to Lady Conway by telephone , we see it as a split screen. Stephen Frears achieved this by filming them simultaneously side by side.
1574
As Ivan Cooper exits home a theater can be seen where the movie Sunday Bloody Sunday which was actually showing at the time is showing.
tp
As Ivan Cooper exits home , a theater can be seen , where the movie Sunday Bloody Sunday , which was actually showing at the time , is showing.
1575
The game that Kevin plays in the car is "Eternal Darkness: Sanity's Requiem".
tp
The game that Kevin plays in the car is "Eternal Darkness : Sanity's Requiem".
1576
Many animation fans have noted the design style of the characters in Eight Crazy Nights is similar to the design style of the characters in The Iron Giant. The majority of the animators that worked on this film were laid off from Warner Bros. Feature Animation (which produced The Iron Giant) and Fox Animation Studios.

1583
When the immigration officers are interrogating Claire Shepard (Alice Eve) there is a brief mention to IMDb. In order to get an American green-card Australian Claire affirms she's a famous TV star in her origin country; therefore she could get a visa for outstanding accomplishment and become an American citizen. However the agents later tell her they've searched her career profile and "according to The Internet Movie Database the only Claire Shepard that matches her spelling age and place of birth has two credits on little known Aussie TV shows."
tp
When the immigration officers are interrogating Claire Shepard ( Alice Eve ), there is a brief mention to IMDb. In order to get an American green - card , Australian Claire affirms she's a famous TV star in her origin country ; therefore , she could get a visa for outstanding accomplishment and become an American citizen. However , the agents later tell her they've searched her career profile and , "according to The Internet Movie Database , the only Claire Shepard that matches her spelling , age and place of birth has two credits on little known Aussie TV shows."
1584

The character Chief Orman was inspired by Marlon Brando . Writer - director Andrew Bergman worked with Brando on The Freshman .

1593

1599
Robert Altman filmed extensively during the real Parisian fashion catwalks capturing the real spring collections of that year and a host of real-life celebrities. Altman and his writer Barbara Shulgasser then integrated several different storylines into the footage that they had acquired.
tp
Robert Altman filmed extensively during the real Parisian fashion catwalks , capturing the real spring collections of that year and a host of real - life celebrities. Altman and his writer Barbara Shulgasser then integrated several different storylines into the footage that they had acquired.
1600
In the early scene at the "Abstinence Now" seminar some of Raquel Alessi's (Cindi Whitehall's) lines were dubbed over for the movie's final release. Originally the story she told on stage prominently featured the word "retard" referring to a baby that was born to an illegitimate mother who smoked. Due to concerns over bad press the word was changed to "crackhead".
fn
null
1601
All the dishes served in the movie was prepared by Food Network chefs who traveled with the crew to do the cooking. They also taught Queen Latifah some basic cooking techniques so she would look like a professional chef in the movie.
tp
All the dishes served in the movie was prepared by Food Network chefs who traveled with the crew to do the cooking. They also taught Queen Latifah some basic cooking techniques so she would look like a professional chef in the movie.
1602
During the dodgeball scene Alvin says to himself "C'mon Alvin remember your five Ds. Dodge duck dip dive and dodge." This is a reference to the "Five Ds of Dodgeball" in Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story. Justin Long who voices Alvin starred in that film.
tp
During the dodgeball scene , Alvin says to himself , "C'mon Alvin , remember your five Ds. Dodge , duck , dip , dive , and dodge." This is a reference to the "Five Ds of Dodgeball" in Dodgeball : A True Underdog Story . Justin Long , who voices Alvin , starred in that film.
1603
Many of the locations featured in the movie are actual locations found in Dallas Texas (e.g. the Texas Club Reunion Arena Dallas City Hall.) However the stainless steel building of the "Moore Company" in the movie is actually the Dallas Federal Reserve Bank (K-11) which is located in the cultural district of Dallas.
tp
Many of the locations featured in the movie are actual locations found in Dallas Texas ( e.g. , the Texas Club , Reunion Arena , Dallas City Hall. ) However , the stainless steel building of the "Moore Company" in the movie is actually the Dallas Federal Reserve Bank ( K - 11 ) which is located in the cultural district of Dallas.
1604
Shabana Azmi was originally given the role of Rizwan's mother but she was forced to withdraw from the movie when Shahrukh Khan's shoulder injury delayed the shooting schedule.
tp
Shabana Azmi was originally given the role of Rizwan's mother , but she was forced to withdraw from the movie when Shahrukh Khan 's shoulder injury delayed the shooting schedule.
1605
Initially Barry Levinson was set to direct.
tp
Initially , Barry Levinson was set to direct.
1606
Goofs Continuity: In the scene where Nicola and Matteo meet again in Nicola's office after Giorgia has been found they lay their right hand on each others shoulder. Nicola's hand is transferred from Matteo's one shoulder to the other in the close-up.
fn

1607
Jennifer Lopez and Constance Marie play mother and daughter when in real life they are only four years apart.
tp
Jennifer Lopez and Constance Marie play mother and daughter , when in real life , they are only four years apart.
1608
In an original script the Rangers were supposed to fight giant Rat Monsters that Ivan Ooze created. Because the suits didn't work well enough and looked "too low budget" for the movie the Rat Monsters were instead replaced by the Ooze Creatures that Ivan creates in the film. However the Rat creature suits didn't go to waste either. Instead they would later appear in the "Return of the Green Ranger" storyline of the Power Rangers television series.
tp
In an original script , the Rangers were supposed to fight giant Rat Monsters that Ivan Ooze created. Because the suits didn't work well enough and looked "too low budget" for the movie , the Rat Monsters were instead replaced by the Ooze Creatures that Ivan creates in the film. However , the Rat creature suits didn't go to waste either. Instead , they would later appear in the "Return of the Green Ranger" storyline of the Power Rangers television series.
1609
The final scene features an opera house rehearsal of Giacomo Puccini's "Nessun Dorma" from Turandot. The complete opera is not being performed because the ending of the piece uses the concert ending.
tp
The final scene features an opera house rehearsal of Giacomo Puccini 's "Nessun Dorma" from Turandot. The complete opera is not being performed because the ending of the piece uses the concert ending.
1610
One of the oft-mentioned photographs involving Edward and Frank features them dressed as Deena and Effie attending the premiere for Dreamgirls. Loretta Devine who portrays Edward's widow Cynthia in this film originated the role of Lorrell in the original 1981 Broadway production of "Dreamgirls" and made a cameo in its 2006 film adaptation. Danny Glover who plays Uncle Russell co-starred in the film version as Marty Madison.
tp
One of the oft - mentioned photographs involving Edward and Frank features them dressed as Deena and Effie attending the premiere for Dreamgirls . Loretta Devine , who portrays Edward's widow Cynthia in this film , originated the role of Lorrell in the original 1981 Broadway production of "Dreamgirls" and made a cameo in its 2006 film adaptation. Danny Glover , who plays Uncle Russell , co - starred in the film version as Marty Madison.

1617
Although the cast of characters mostly reflects the 1937-39 incarnation of the gang notable exceptions include: Stymie (1930-35) Froggie (1940-44 who actually replaced Alfalfa as Spanky's sidekick) Uh-huh (1933) and Miss Crabtree (1930-32).
tp
Although the cast of characters mostly reflects the 1937 - 39 incarnation of the gang , notable exceptions include : Stymie ( 1930 - 35 ), Froggie ( 1940 - 44 , who actually replaced Alfalfa as Spanky's sidekick ), Uh - huh ( 1933 ), and Miss Crabtree ( 1930 - 32 ) .
1618
Originally set for a US theatrical release in 2005 the film was pushed back after poor test screenings. Ultimately the film was release direct-to-DVD in the domestic market after remaining unreleased during a sustained time of uncertainty.

1620
The real Champions League Final Game was Arsenal vs. Barcelona with Barcelona winning 2-1. Real Madrid lost to Arsenal in the first knock-out round with a 1-0 overall score in both legs.
tp
The real Champions League Final Game was Arsenal vs. Barcelona with Barcelona winning 2 - 1. Real Madrid lost to Arsenal in the first knock - out round with a 1 - 0 overall score in both legs.

1623
The concept of the film arose from a joke Tom Six made with friends about punishing child molesters by stitching their "mouth to the ass of a fat truck driver."

1626
The lines of the radio owner during the scene where Billy Bob Thornton is talked out of bulldozing the church were improvised.
tp
The lines of the radio owner during the scene where Billy Bob Thornton is talked out of bulldozing the church were improvised.
1627
"The Women's" screenwriter Anita Loos who wrote this film's original 1939 screenplay started her writing career in 1912 with her first full film screenplay The Musketeers of Pig Alley starring Lillian Gish for the American Mutoscope & Biograph Co. which is still in existence today. After writing many scripts for Biograph Loos went on to write such other films such as Saratoga Another Thin Man San Francisco A Tree Grows in Brooklyn and Gentlemen Prefer Blondes.
fp
"The Women's" screenwriter Anita Loos who wrote this film's original 1939 screenplay , started her writing career in 1912 with her first full film screenplay The Musketeers of Pig Alley starring Lillian Gish for the American Mutoscope & Biograph Co. which is still in existence today. After writing many scripts for Biograph , Loos went on to write such other films such as Saratoga , Another Thin Man , San Francisco , A Tree Grows in Brooklyn , and Gentlemen Prefer Blondes .
1628
After failing to bring in audiences as a comedy under the original title "Renaissance Man" the movie was re-released to theaters a couple months later marketed as a drama with the alternate title "By The Book" and unsurprisingly pulled in far fewer receipts the second time through the theaters.
tp
After failing to bring in audiences as a comedy under the original title "Renaissance Man" , the movie was re - released to theaters a couple months later marketed as a drama with the alternate title "By The Book" , and unsurprisingly pulled in far fewer receipts the second time through the theaters.
1629
The falcon was supposed to have an army of pigeons as his minions.
tp
The falcon was supposed to have an army of pigeons as his minions.
1630
Alex Garland wrote the film as a "love letter" to psychologically-minded science-fiction and also a film about atheism and "meeting God". He and director Danny Boyle differed in their interpretation of this aspect of this film but found this did not affect the content of the movie. Garland remarks that they had reached "the same two interpretations that could be made from the world around us".
tp
Alex Garland wrote the film as a "love letter" to psychologically - minded science - fiction , and also a film about atheism and "meeting God". He and director Danny Boyle differed in their interpretation of this aspect of this film , but found this did not affect the content of the movie. Garland remarks that they had reached "the same two interpretations that could be made from the world around us".
1631
After Jodie Foster and Jonathan Demme dropped out Anthony Hopkins was very reluctant in returning to play Lecter and producers considered 'Tim Roth' as a replacement.
tp
After Jodie Foster and Jonathan Demme dropped out , Anthony Hopkins was very reluctant in returning to play Lecter , and producers considered 'Tim Roth' as a replacement.
1632
Shot in chronological order.
tp
Shot in chronological order.
1633
The interior of Ethan Hunt's house was based on 'JJ Abrams''s family's home.
tp
The interior of Ethan Hunt's house was based on 'JJ Abrams''s family's home.
1634
Part of the influence for this film can be seen in an early sketch Mike Myers did for Saturday Night Live in which several of James Bond's nemeses complain about his invulnerability and how much easier it should be to kill him.
tp
Part of the influence for this film can be seen in an early sketch Mike Myers did for Saturday Night Live in which several of James Bond's nemeses complain about his invulnerability and how much easier it should be to kill him.
1635
In the movie John Dillinger and other bank robbers are seen having friendly relations with the Chicago mobsters. Specifically with Phillip D'Andrea a top lieutenant in the Al Capone mob. In real life Al Capone was said to admire bank robbers and would often allow bandits safe haven in Chicago under the mob's protection. However as also shown in the movie after Frank Nitti took over the mob following Al Capone's conviction for tax evasion he cut off such resources to outlaws like Dillinger Baby Face Nelson and Alvin Carpis because of the "heat" that was being brought down on the mobs because of the FBI's furious hunt for these men.
tp
In the movie , John Dillinger and other bank robbers are seen having friendly relations with the Chicago mobsters. Specifically with Phillip D'Andrea , a top lieutenant in the Al Capone mob. In real life , Al Capone was said to admire bank robbers and would often allow bandits safe haven in Chicago under the mob's protection. However , as also shown in the movie , after Frank Nitti took over the mob following Al Capone's conviction for tax evasion , he cut off such resources to outlaws like Dillinger , Baby Face Nelson , and Alvin Carpis because of the "heat" that was being brought down on the mobs because of the FBI's furious hunt for these men.
1636
One of the original directors set up to do this was B-movie veteran William Lustig. But Tarantino turned him down because he did not believe he could do like Jonathan Demme (who went from B-movies to "regular" feature movies).
tp
One of the original directors set up to do this was B - movie veteran William Lustig . But Tarantino turned him down because he did not believe he could do like Jonathan Demme ( who went from B - movies to "regular" feature movies ) .
1637
During the scene where Sphinx and Mirror Man are stealing the HumVee 2-Door Pickup it was not originally scripted for the police car to fall off of the ramp. Vinnie Jones had pushed the stunt driver just a little off of the ramp but did not have enough room to drive the HumVee past. He gave it a little more gas and the HumVee smashed the car off the ramp. In the elevator afterwards Jones said to the stuntman "That'll teach ya!"
tp
During the scene where Sphinx and Mirror Man are stealing the HumVee 2 - Door Pickup , it was not originally scripted for the police car to fall off of the ramp. Vinnie Jones had pushed the stunt driver just a little off of the ramp but did not have enough room to drive the HumVee past. He gave it a little more gas and the HumVee smashed the car off the ramp. In the elevator afterwards Jones said to the stuntman , "That'll teach ya!"
1638
According to his online diary Jackie Chan recorded his voice-overs during a single 5 hour recording session in LA on October 15 2007. He also recorded his lines for the Mandarin and Cantonese versions.
fn
null
1639
Amy Adams was considered to play Alma but declined.
tp
Amy Adams was considered to play Alma , but declined.
1640
Mark Wahlberg joined the film after meeting with Tim Burton for only five minutes. He was so anxious to work with the director that he agreed to play any part. Wahlberg dropped out of the role of Linus in Ocean's Eleven to do this film. He refused to wear a loincloth like Charlton Heston did in Planet of the Apes because he did not want to remind audiences of his underwear modeling.
tp
Mark Wahlberg joined the film after meeting with Tim Burton for only five minutes. He was so anxious to work with the director that he agreed to play any part. Wahlberg dropped out of the role of Linus in Ocean's Eleven to do this film. He refused to wear a loincloth like Charlton Heston did in Planet of the Apes because he did not want to remind audiences of his underwear modeling.
1641
The film was originally going to be shot in Panavision as Oliver Stone's previous four films had been but he decided that it should be framed in standard 1.85:1. The Panavision E-Series anamorphic lenses that had been reserved for the film were used to shoot The Pelican Brief instead.
tp
The film was originally going to be shot in Panavision , as Oliver Stone 's previous four films had been , but he decided that it should be framed in standard 1.85 : 1. The Panavision E - Series anamorphic lenses that had been reserved for the film were used to shoot The Pelican Brief instead.
1642
Although a non-stop action film not a single explosion occurs throughout. 2 September 2006 by Ziad Saleh (Canada) – See all my reviews
fp
Although a non - stop action film , not a single explosion occurs throughout.
1643
The story's timeline begins in 1977 (among other things Reed Rothchild mentions Star Wars: A New Hope) and while an exact year is not specified in the final few scenes it is clear that it ends in 1984. Among other things Jack Horner makes a reference to Buck and Jessie's baby as "an Olympic swimmer" (the Summer Olympics in 1984 were held in Los Angeles) and Dirk Diggler's outfit in the final scene is identical to the kind of clothes that Don Johnson wore on Miami Vice (which began airing on NBC in 1984).
tp
The story's timeline begins in 1977 ( among other things , Reed Rothchild mentions Star Wars : A New Hope ) and , while an exact year is not specified in the final few scenes , it is clear that it ends in 1984. Among other things , Jack Horner makes a reference to Buck and Jessie's baby as "an Olympic swimmer" ( the Summer Olympics in 1984 were held in Los Angeles ) and Dirk Diggler's outfit in the final scene is identical to the kind of clothes that Don Johnson wore on Miami Vice ( which began airing on NBC in 1984 ) .
1644
Eminem reportedly turned down an offer to star in the lead role. But an MTV report quoted director Doug Liman saying that his plan to have Eminem in the movie was dropped right after he met Hayden Christensen.
tp
Eminem reportedly turned down an offer to star in the lead role. But an MTV report quoted director Doug Liman saying that his plan to have Eminem in the movie was dropped right after he met Hayden Christensen .
1645
The MPAA would not allow the movie to use the title unless they found a family with the name "Focker".
tp
The MPAA would not allow the movie to use the title unless they found a family with the name "Focker".
1646
The stickers on Scrad's/Charlie's fridge door: "LOSER" "MY OTHER CAR - IS A SKATEBOARD - ALTERNATIVE PRESS" "HARASSING ME ABOUT MY SMOKING MAY BE HAZARDOUS TO YOUR HEALTH" "Your Kid's An Honor Student - But You're A Moron" "The Truth is NOT out There!" "BARTHAT - *SUCKS* - TIGERMASK - ..." "NEW YORK - MAFIA" "Greetings from New York City" (on postcard showing a heist)
tp

1647
Rob's sticker-covered "little black book" is a Chandler's assignment notebook a required item for every student at Evanston Township High School John Cusack's alma mater.
tp
Rob's sticker - covered "little black book" is a Chandler's assignment notebook , a required item for every student at Evanston Township High School , John Cusack 's alma mater.
1648
Many elements in the plot of "GoldenEye" reference the 1983 Bond film Never Say Never Again which was made by a rival company. The character of Xenia Onatopp is much like Fatima Blush in the older film. Other common elements include a laser mounted on a watch an exploding click-pen and the Monte Carlo casino.
tp
Many elements in the plot of "GoldenEye" reference the 1983 Bond film Never Say Never Again , which was made by a rival company. The character of Xenia Onatopp is much like Fatima Blush in the older film. Other common elements include a laser mounted on a watch , an exploding click - pen , and the Monte Carlo casino.
1649
Series trademark: Burt Bacharach cameo. This time however he only appears during the closing credits.
tp
Series trademark : Burt Bacharach cameo. This time , however , he only appears during the closing credits.
1650
When Stacy confronts Barb on camera backstage the monitor above their heads appears to flip the image but it's not a monitor it's the back of the projection screen from the main televised image that is the centrepiece of the Kippie Kann Show stage's back wall.
tp
When Stacy confronts Barb on camera backstage , the monitor above their heads appears to flip the image , but it's not a monitor , it's the back of the projection screen from the main televised image that is the centrepiece of the Kippie Kann Show stage's back wall.
1651
Local legend has it that John Wilkes Booth evaded capture in Virginia after his assassination of Abraham Lincoln and was the caretaker on the ranch property. He told the property owners his true identity as he was dying. They buried him in an unmarked grave next to the oak tree which Mandy Lane walks by to see Garth.
tp
Local legend has it that John Wilkes Booth evaded capture in Virginia after his assassination of Abraham Lincoln and was the caretaker on the ranch property. He told the property owners his true identity as he was dying. They buried him in an unmarked grave next to the oak tree which Mandy Lane walks by to see Garth.
1652
The sequence in which Reese gives Amy a ride to the library was the last scene shot in the film.
tp
The sequence in which Reese gives Amy a ride to the library was the last scene shot in the film.
1653
Stacy Edwards (Christine) originally could not star because she was getting married at the time the movie was scheduled to start shooting. The producers pushed back the schedule to accommodate her.

null
1654
Quotes P'tit Lys: The prince went slowly through the forest. His beautiful horse was silent. The sky was taking on the color of roses. "Will I be in time?" the prince wondered. He remembered what the magician had told him. "Night is your only enemy. Once it has cast its cloak of darkness over the world and you cannot tell the shadow of a dog from that of a wolf you will know it is too late and that your beautiful lady is lost forever. Hurry if you love her." The prince's heart was pounding.
fn
null
1655
Director Davis Guggenheim's parents Marion Guggenheim and director Charles Guggenheim were cast as Derrick's parents but their scene was cut. The brunette that Derrick gets together with at the party had her voice dubbed by the Davis' wife Elisabeth Shue because the original actress's voice was not deemed sexy enough.
tp
Director Davis Guggenheim 's parents , Marion Guggenheim and director Charles Guggenheim , were cast as Derrick's parents but their scene was cut. The brunette that Derrick gets together with at the party had her voice dubbed by the Davis' wife , Elisabeth Shue , because the original actress's voice was not deemed sexy enough.
1656
The film was originally rated X by the MPAA. It was re-edited many times so the MPAA would give it an R rating.
fn
null
1657
Primo Tony Shalhoub's name in Big Night translates as "First". Secondo 'Stanley Tucci''s character translates as "Second". This relates to their birth order in the film. It is briefly referenced in the Cadillac scene when Secondo meets Bob (the car salesman played by Campbell Scott). (Additionally Shalhoub's character in The Impostors was named Voltri First Mate - a possible reference to Primo.)
tp
Primo , Tony Shalhoub 's name in Big Night , translates as "First". Secondo , 'Stanley Tucci''s character , translates as "Second". This relates to their birth order in the film. It is briefly referenced in the Cadillac scene when Secondo meets Bob ( the car salesman played by Campbell Scott ) . ( Additionally , Shalhoub's character in The Impostors was named Voltri , First Mate - a possible reference to Primo. )
1658
All of the Union soldiers who are killed during the movie do not have the standard issue Ronald F. Maxwell knew who was a stunt man.
tp
All of the Union soldiers who are killed during the movie do not have the standard issue Ronald F. Maxwell knew who was a stunt man.

The black and white picture of the guy on death row in the cabin is the same one used in the original version of this movie ( Nightwatch).

1660
In the scene where Tak Sakaguchi's character holds a pistol in his mouth the director originally called for him to rack the slide with his teeth. He tried this and broke a tooth. One of the zombies was played by a dentist and fixed it for him.
fn
null
1661
All of the scenes involving wolves were shot on sets designed and created by Production Designer Kevin Phipps. These include all of the Forest Creek and River settings the Interior of the Chapel the Hotel Bedroom and Absinthe Factory. These sets were all constructed on the sound stages at Media Pro studios in Bucharest Romania.
fn
null
1662
Shipped to theaters under the name "Needs Work"
tp
Shipped to theaters under the name "Needs Work"
1663
Jackie Chan himself filmed an explosion scene. When the fiery police car came sliding dangerously close the crew jumped out of the way and tried to pull Jackie out of harm's way. But Jackie yelled "No! Don't run!" and continued filming what turned out to be a spectacular piece of action.
tp
Jackie Chan himself filmed an explosion scene. When the fiery police car came sliding dangerously close , the crew jumped out of the way and tried to pull Jackie out of harm's way. But Jackie yelled , "No! Don't run!" and continued filming what turned out to be a spectacular piece of action.
1664
Jon Lovitz refers to 'Bill McKinney' playing one of the "hick" robbers as "pig boy". Bill McKinney played the "squeal like pig boy" rapist in Deliverance.
tp
Jon Lovitz refers to 'Bill McKinney' , playing one of the "hick" robbers , as "pig boy". Bill McKinney played the "squeal like pig , boy" rapist in Deliverance .

1673
The film crew could not get permission for filming from a helicopter in the National Park of "Las Cañadas del Teide" so they used a remote controlled mini-helicopter.
fn
null
1674
The leather jacket that Greg Kinnear wore while playing 'Bob Crane' in the Hogan's Heroes scenes in this movie was the one that 'Bob Crane' actually wore during that TV series Hogan's Heroes. Crane's son Bob Jr. (Robert David Crane) loaned the jacket to Greg Kinnear for this movie. Prior to Hogan's Heroes this jacket was worn by Frank Sinatra in Von Ryan's Express.
tp
The leather jacket that Greg Kinnear wore while playing 'Bob Crane' in the Hogan's Heroes scenes in this movie was the one that 'Bob Crane' actually wore during that TV series Hogan's Heroes . Crane's son Bob Jr. ( Robert David Crane ) loaned the jacket to Greg Kinnear for this movie. Prior to Hogan's Heroes , this jacket was worn by Frank Sinatra in Von Ryan's Express .
1675
Colt was originally named Pony.
tp
Colt was originally named Pony.
1676
Goofs Continuity: In the scene in the backyard where Henry tries to catch the little girl he falls. While lying on the ground he takes a sip of his beverage which is almost empty. When he gets up the drink is half full and a lime has appeared in it.

null
1677
Every scene from Elling's neighborhood were shot around Majorstuen on Oslo's west side. The locations such as the grocery store where he hides his poems in packages of sauerkraut and the diner where they eat dinner are all very real places. Both in name and appearance the shop and diner look exactly the same today.
fn
null
1678
Almost at the end of the film is an aerial shot the camera speeding toward six descendants of the villagers standing on Ffynnon Garw which is just like a shot at the end of Sirens. Both films starred Hugh Grant and Tara Fitzgerald and Robert Jones was an executive producer on both.
tp
Almost at the end of the film is an aerial shot , the camera speeding toward six descendants of the villagers standing on Ffynnon Garw , which is just like a shot at the end of Sirens . Both films starred Hugh Grant and Tara Fitzgerald , and Robert Jones was an executive producer on both.
1679
The poetry quoted by the narrator at the end of the film is Part 40 of A.E. Housman's "A Shropshire Lad": Into my heart an air that kills From yon far country blows: What are those blue remembered hills What spires what farms are those? That is the land of lost content I see it shining plain The happy highways where I went And cannot come again.

null

1681
"Professor Durkheim" is presumably named after the French sociologist Emile Durkheim who was the first academic to study suicide extensively.
tp
"Professor Durkheim" is presumably named after the French sociologist Emile Durkheim , who was the first academic to study suicide extensively.
1682
The Mental Institution scenes were filmed at the Northampton State Hospital an actual asylum in Northampton Massachussets which was abandoned at the time.
tp
The Mental Institution scenes were filmed at the Northampton State Hospital , an actual asylum in Northampton , Massachussets , which was abandoned at the time.
1683
It was Jean-Claude Van Damme's idea that Asian action director Ringo Lam direct this film as his American directorial debut.
tp
It was Jean - Claude Van Damme 's idea that Asian action director Ringo Lam direct this film , as his American directorial debut.

1696

1697
The "male" bovines having udders was explained in the October 2006 issue of Nickelodeon's official magazine "Nick Magazine". In the letters page one reader asked about the anatomically-incorrect cows(bovine) and whether or not it was intentional or not and the magazine explained that the movie's director "thought it would be funny for the male cows(bulls) to have udders".
fn
null
1698
The movie is only 73 minutes long with two minutes of "where are they now?" and six minutes of credits for a running time of 81 minutes.
tp
The movie is only 73 minutes long , with two minutes of "where are they now?" and six minutes of credits for a running time of 81 minutes.

1700
Since Annie Wu didn't speak Cantonese at that time (she was just learning the language) all of her scenes and those of Uncle Seven and his family (including Jackson Lau) were done in Mandarin. Thus most of this film was shot in Mandarin not Cantonese.
tp
Since Annie Wu didn't speak Cantonese at that time ( she was just learning the language ), all of her scenes and those of Uncle Seven and his family ( including Jackson Lau ) were done in Mandarin. Thus , most of this film was shot in Mandarin , not Cantonese.
1701
Rebecca Pidgeon who plays Edmond's wife also starred opposite William H. Macy in the original stage version of Oleanna also written by David Mamet.
tp
Rebecca Pidgeon , who plays Edmond's wife , also starred opposite William H. Macy in the original stage version of Oleanna , also written by David Mamet .

Vera Wang designed all of Katie Holmes' ballgowns for this film. (Her originals usually retail for over $10000 each.)

Jet Li's voice is dubbed in post-production because he is not a Cantonese speaker. In fact he spoke in Mandarin entirely during filming.

1704
Kate Bosworth was originally cast as Anna but was replaced by Christina Ricci.
fn
null
1705
Based on the novel The Dark is Rising by Susan Cooper which is part of a series of five books collectively called The Dark is Rising Sequence. The Dark is Rising is in fact the second book in the series and the first to feature the character of Will Stanton who is arguably the hero of the rest of the series. The first book Over Sea Under Stone focuses on three younger children: Simon Jane and Barney Drew who appear in every other book in the series. The only common character between the first two books is Merriman Lyon.
tp
Based on the novel The Dark is Rising by Susan Cooper , which is part of a series of five books collectively called The Dark is Rising Sequence . The Dark is Rising is in fact the second book in the series , and the first to feature the character of Will Stanton , who is arguably the hero of the rest of the series. The first book , Over Sea , Under Stone focuses on three younger children : Simon , Jane and Barney Drew , who appear in every other book in the series. The only common character between the first two books is Merriman Lyon.
1706
Edward Norton was so desperate to star in this movie that he took a pay cut stating in an interview that he "actually got paid half what I usually make". 17 September 2009 by Greg Magne (grmagne@yahoo.com) (Toronto ON Canada) – See all my reviews
fp
Edward Norton was so desperate to star in this movie that he took a pay cut , stating in an interview that he "actually got paid half what I usually make".
1707
References to Encino Man which also starred Pauly Shore and Brendan Fraser.
tp
References to Encino Man , which also starred Pauly Shore and Brendan Fraser .
1708
This movie began creating controversy even before it was released. Several groups most of them related to church tried to ban the movie. They did not succeed; instead tickets were sold out on opening weekend.
tp
This movie began creating controversy even before it was released. Several groups , most of them related to church , tried to ban the movie. They did not succeed ; instead , tickets were sold out on opening weekend.
1709
Ewan McGregor's nude scenes were originally going to be cut from the U.S. release but after McGregor objected the full-frontal nude scenes were put back in.
tp
Ewan McGregor 's nude scenes were originally going to be cut from the U.S. release , but after McGregor objected , the full - frontal nude scenes were put back in.
1710
The name of the strip club is "Rhino's" both a pun on the real life "Spearmint Rhino" and the book "Rhinocerous".
tp
The name of the strip club is "Rhino's" both a pun on the real life "Spearmint Rhino" and the book "Rhinocerous".

1725
Goofs Continuity: When Jeremy throws his laptop on the floor what appears to be the battery flies out and lands on the floor next to the laptop and the cover is completely closed. The scene cuts to a closeup of him looking down at what he had just done then it cuts to him bending down to pick it up. The laptop is now partly open the screen is lit and the battery is no longer anywhere to be seen on the floor.
fn
null
1726
Original title: "Ivy" and "Our House".
tp
Original title : "Ivy" and "Our House".
1727
The film was initially supposed to be released in October 1999. Its trailer was in theaters in Summer 1999. However due to a flood of "End of the World" movies coming out at the exact same time ( End of Days Stigmata etc...) the decision was made to delay the film. Its new date was 4 February 2000. However that date was canceled after the very popular "Scream" franchise staked out that date for its final installment Scream 3. The final release date of 13 October 2000 was finally decided upon which also happened to be the same exact day as the re-release of The Exorcist.
tp
The film was initially supposed to be released in October 1999. Its trailer was in theaters in Summer 1999. However , due to a flood of "End of the World" movies coming out at the exact same time ( End of Days , Stigmata , etc... ), the decision was made to delay the film. Its new date was 4 February 2000. However , that date was canceled after the very popular "Scream" franchise staked out that date for its final installment , Scream 3 . The final release date of 13 October 2000 , was finally decided upon , which also happened to be the same exact day as the re - release of The Exorcist .
1728
Goofs Continuity: The D train that Jose and Nina take passes over the same bridge twice one at the beginning of it's trip and one near the end of their trip.
fn
null

Sigourney Weaver was nominated for the 1985 Tony Award (New York City) for Supporting or Features Actress in a Musical for "Hurlyburly" for the role of Darlene.
tp
Sigourney Weaver was nominated for the 1985 Tony Award ( New York City ) for Supporting or Features Actress in a Musical for "Hurlyburly" for the role of Darlene.

1732
Alvin Greenman (The Doorman) appeared in the original version as Alfred.
tp
Alvin Greenman ( The Doorman ) appeared in the original version as Alfred.
1733
Average Shot Length (ASL) = 4.5 seconds (2005 DVD Version). This is fast by most 1970s' film standards but quite slow for Sam Peckinpah. For example The Wild Bunch has an A.S.L. of three seconds Junior Bonner 3.5 seconds The Killer Elite four seconds.
tp
Average Shot Length ( ASL ) = 4.5 seconds ( 2005 DVD Version ) . This is fast by most 1970s' film standards , but quite slow for Sam Peckinpah . For example , The Wild Bunch has an A.S.L. of three seconds , Junior Bonner 3.5 seconds , The Killer Elite four seconds.

Quotes [From trailer] Varek: I am not human... We're better than that.

1736
This film was loosely based on a true story of a kidnapped boy from Milan and the novella written about the incident.
fn

1737
Gary R. Wordham was the name of the actor that is credited as the flirting intern at the hospital. This was also the name that was used on the passport Alec Baldwin's character used when he flew to Guatemala.
tp
Gary R. Wordham was the name of the actor that is credited as the flirting intern at the hospital. This was also the name that was used on the passport Alec Baldwin 's character used when he flew to Guatemala.
1738
Amongst those able to view Billy Bob Thornton's original cut which ran for 3 hours 40 minutes opinions were divided. Ben Affleck remarked that it was "brilliant a masterpiece". Former Miramax marketing head Dennis Rice had this to say: "It was the most self-indulgent director's cut I'd ever seen. It was like torture to watch that movie."
tp
Amongst those able to view Billy Bob Thornton 's original cut , which ran for 3 hours 40 minutes , opinions were divided. Ben Affleck remarked that it was "brilliant , a masterpiece". Former Miramax marketing head Dennis Rice had this to say : "It was the most self - indulgent director's cut I'd ever seen. It was like torture to watch that movie."

1748
The background for the artificial set in the prologue is clearly inspired by the woodblock prints "Gaifu Kaisei" and "Sanka Haku" featured in Hokusai's famous "Thirty Six Views of Mount Fuji" series.
tp
The background for the artificial set in the prologue is clearly inspired by the woodblock prints "Gaifu Kaisei" and "Sanka Haku" featured in Hokusai's famous "Thirty Six Views of Mount Fuji" series.
1749
Pootie's license plate reads "CLEEPA"
tp

1752

fn

1753
The first Disney movie to not have "THE END" at the end of the film. Instead it just goes straight from the final scene to the closing credits of the movie. A few later films such as The Great Mouse Detective and Aladdin would have "THE END" appear before the credits roll but this was for a special occasion usually.
tp
The first Disney movie to not have "THE END" at the end of the film. Instead , it just goes straight from the final scene to the closing credits of the movie. A few later films , such as The Great Mouse Detective and Aladdin would have "THE END" appear before the credits roll , but this was for a special occasion usually.
1754
The painting sold before Roxy's LaTour is Claude-Joseph Vernet's "La Nuit au Port au Clair de Lune" which is in the Louvre's permanent collection.
tp
The painting sold before Roxy's LaTour is Claude - Joseph Vernet's "La Nuit , au Port au Clair de Lune" , which is in the Louvre's permanent collection.
1755
Several performers repeated their roles from the Royal National Theatre production and/or the US tour including Nigel Hawthorne Julian Wadham Julian Rhind-Tutt Anthony Calf Matthew Lloyd Davies Paul Corrigan Roger Hammond and Cyril Shaps. Three others make cameos: Iain Mitchell (the original Sheridan) Nick Sampson (Prince of Wales on tour) and Selina Cadell (Queen Charlotte on tour).
tp
Several performers repeated their roles from the Royal National Theatre production and / or the US tour , including Nigel Hawthorne , Julian Wadham , Julian Rhind - Tutt , Anthony Calf , Matthew Lloyd Davies , Paul Corrigan , Roger Hammond , and Cyril Shaps . Three others make cameos : Iain Mitchell ( the original Sheridan ), Nick Sampson ( Prince of Wales on tour ), and Selina Cadell ( Queen Charlotte on tour ) .
1756
Steve Martin and Scott Caan did not get along during filming due to Caan's reckless behavior toward a stunt person in a scene in which his character smashes a beer bottle over the head of a man in a bar.
tp

1758
During King Henry's visit a monk is forcibly detained in an attempt to give Henry a paper. In reality King Henry III was killed exactly so: a monk under the subterfuge of giving Henry a private message fatally stabbed him while whispering in his ear.

1764

tp

1765
In one scene Trevor falls asleep while reading Dostoevsky's The Idiot. Two of the characters in that book are Marie and Nicholas.
tp
In one scene Trevor falls asleep while reading Dostoevsky's The Idiot . Two of the characters in that book are Marie and Nicholas.
1766
Despite the fact that there have been many other Alice in Wonderland films Tim Burton has said he never felt a emotional connection to it and always thought it was a series of some girl wondering around from one crazy character to another. (In fact the original books are part of a once-popular fantasy genre in which the character does nothing except wander around from one crazy encounter to another. Those films which replicated this were being true to the spirit of the original books.) So with this he attempted to create a framework an emotional grounding which he felt he never really had seen in any version before. Tim said that was the challenge for him - to make Alice feel like a story as opposed to a series of events.
tp
Despite the fact that there have been many other Alice in Wonderland films , Tim Burton has said he never felt a emotional connection to it and always thought it was a series of some girl wondering around from one crazy character to another. ( In fact , the original books are part of a once - popular fantasy genre in which the character does nothing except wander around from one crazy encounter to another. Those films which replicated this were being true to the spirit of the original books. ) So with this , he attempted to create a framework , an emotional grounding , which he felt he never really had seen in any version before. Tim said that was the challenge for him - to make Alice feel like a story as opposed to a series of events.
1767
Ron Perlman broke a rib while filming the subway scenes. He jumped onto a train that was coming towards him at about 45 mph.
tp
Ron Perlman broke a rib while filming the subway scenes. He jumped onto a train that was coming towards him at about 45 mph.
1768
While filming Ben Stiller and Owen Wilson only had one day that they saw each other. Stiller talked to a toothpick for the Jedediah scenes then three months later Wilson came in and filmed all of his parts.
tp
While filming , Ben Stiller and Owen Wilson only had one day that they saw each other. Stiller talked to a toothpick for the Jedediah scenes , then three months later Wilson came in and filmed all of his parts.

Clint Eastwood agreed to direct the same afternoon he read the script.

In the book Andy's boyfriend Nate is a teacher. In the movie he is a chef. His name was also Alex in the book.
tp

1771
Susan Orlean was at first concerned that some people would think her portrayal in the film was accurate but was then reminded how Charlie Kaufman portrays himself in the film.
tp
Susan Orlean was at first concerned that some people would think her portrayal in the film was accurate , but was then reminded how Charlie Kaufman portrays himself in the film.
1772
Mononoke means angry or vengeful spirit. Hime is the Japanese honorific word that means princess which in the rules of Japanese grammar is placed after a person's name instead of before as is the custom in many Western languages. When the film's title was translated into English it was decided that Mononoke would be left as a name rather than translated literally.
fn
null
1773
Fearing typecasting Shannon Elizabeth declined to perform a nude scene for this sequel.
tp
Fearing typecasting , Shannon Elizabeth declined to perform a nude scene for this sequel.
1774
The film was shot in a six week period.
tp
The film was shot in a six week period.
1775
In its initial release this never expanded beyond 169 screens hence its disappointing box office numbers.
tp
In its initial release , this never expanded beyond 169 screens , hence its disappointing box office numbers.
1776
The actors were subjected to about 15 underwater training sessions in swimming pools around the Los Angeles area before arriving at the underwater set where they underwent a further 2 weeks of training before anything was shot. Sigourney Weaver missed most of this because she had been appearing in a play on Broadway just prior to filming.
tp
The actors were subjected to about 15 underwater training sessions in swimming pools around the Los Angeles area before arriving at the underwater set where they underwent a further 2 weeks of training before anything was shot. Sigourney Weaver missed most of this because she had been appearing in a play on Broadway just prior to filming.

The film was shown out of competition at the 2005 Cannes Film Festival.

Many of the creatures in the film were played by dancers so they could be flexible enough to create the required disturbing movements.

Lefty's real name is Benjamin which in Hebrew means "son of the right hand".

1781
"Jocko" was played by Sivuqaq one of four walruses living at Six Flags Marine World in Vallejo CA. The three female walruses featured in the film are named Siku Uquq and Qiluk.
tp

1782
Woodstock's nickname for Ace Ventura is "St. Francis". This is in reference to St. Francis of Assisi the Catholic patron saint of animals.
tp
Woodstock's nickname for Ace Ventura is "St. Francis". This is in reference to St. Francis of Assisi , the Catholic patron saint of animals.

1786
Paul Rudd lost 25 pounds for the film.

1787
The film went over budget from the orignal $15 million to $2 million (the highest budget for a Mexican movie at the time). del Toro himself got the half million through loans and bank debts. In order to complete the film changes had to be made among those changes were Ron Perlman who agreed to a heavy salary cut. Perlman and del Toro has been good friends ever since working together frequently.
tp
The film went over budget from the orignal $1 , 5 million to $2 million ( the highest budget for a Mexican movie at the time ) . del Toro himself got the half million through loans and bank debts. In order to complete the film , changes had to be made , among those changes were Ron Perlman , who agreed to a heavy salary cut. Perlman and del Toro has been good friends ever since , working together frequently.
1788
The three-toned art-deco console radio seen in an office sequence is a Midwest Radio Model B-16 from 1936.
tp
The three - toned art - deco console radio seen in an office sequence is a Midwest Radio Model B - 16 from 1936.

1790
Ashley Judd was almost never cast because the producers and director thought that she was beyond their budget. Her agent later contacted and informed them that Judd was interested in playing Linda.
tp
Ashley Judd was almost never cast because the producers and director thought that she was beyond their budget. Her agent later contacted and informed them that Judd was interested in playing Linda.
1791
Alicia Silverstone became an "emancipated minor" at age 15 during the shooting of the film meaning she was legally on her own and not a dependent of her parents. This way she could avoid child labor laws which would have restricted how many hours she could work on the film.
tp
Alicia Silverstone became an "emancipated minor" at age 15 during the shooting of the film meaning she was legally on her own and not a dependent of her parents. This way she could avoid child labor laws , which would have restricted how many hours she could work on the film.
1792
In accordance with the film's strong political theme the official Internet site used a grassroots pre-publicity marketing strategy. Users on the site dubbed "American Carolers" could make use of online tools to email friends about the film network with other fans etc. Points were given based on participation and prizes (tickets posters etc) were awarded to the highest scorers. The names of the top 16 "Carolers" are on the DVD in the Bonus Features under "Special Thanks".
tp
In accordance with the film's strong political theme , the official Internet site used a grassroots pre - publicity marketing strategy. Users on the site , dubbed "American Carolers" , could make use of online tools to email friends about the film , network with other fans , etc. Points were given based on participation , and prizes ( tickets , posters , etc ) were awarded to the highest scorers. The names of the top 16 "Carolers" are on the DVD , in the Bonus Features under "Special Thanks".
1793
The song playing in the smoke shop is "Drug Day Afternoon" written and performed by Emile Hirsch and Ryan Donowho. Hirsch also sings the song when he is going up his stairs on crutches.
tp
The song playing in the smoke shop is "Drug Day Afternoon" , written and performed by Emile Hirsch and Ryan Donowho . Hirsch also sings the song when he is going up his stairs on crutches.
1794
In the original script Abbie worked as a swimming instructor. After reading it Madonna decided that the character should be a yoga instructor.
tp
In the original script , Abbie worked as a swimming instructor. After reading it , Madonna decided that the character should be a yoga instructor.
1795
The sky banner at the end of the movie would've cost the Solomon brothers $80350. With a 6% sales tax the total would've come to $85171. 25 December 2009 by Phil Reinking (United States) – See all my reviews
fp
The sky banner at the end of the movie would've cost the Solomon brothers $80 , 350. With a 6% sales tax , the total would've come to $85 , 171.

This included the drastic shortening of both Jeff Wolfe and Michael Miller 's fights against Jean - Claude Van Damme in the finale. In the UK DVD Making Of , a glimpse of Jeff Wolfe's extended fight can be seen
1812
In 1999 Sony Pictures Entertainment purchased the film rights to Astro Boy from Osamu Tezuka Productions intending to produce a combination live-action/animatronics/CGI feature film alongside Jim Henson Productions originally slated for a Christmas 2000 release with Eric Leighton (Dinosaur) attached to direct. This came to no result and in June 2004 Leighton was replaced with accomplished animator Genndy Tartakovsky ( Dexter's Laboratory Samurai Jack) with a scheduled 2007 release. However some time after this announcement was made Tartakovsky left the film to produce The Dark Crystal's sequel The Power of the Dark Crystal also for Jim Henson Productions.
fn
null
1813
Jean-Pierre Jeunet's comeback after a five year break since A Very Long Engagement.

1847

fn
null
1848
Director Sidney Lumet writes in his book "Making Movies" about an argument between River Phoenix and writer Naomi Foner. A scene in the movie concerns the character played by Phoenix being interrupted while practicing a classical piano solo. In the script when he is caught he breaks into a jazz riff to cover his "embarrassment" at being caught doing something serious. Phoenix fought hard against this feeling that his character would never be embarrassed about working at the piano. Lumet was so impressed by the point Phoenix made he shot the scene the way Phoenix wanted it.
fn
null
1849
Employee photos and names seen at STARKE Pharmaceuticals including those on ID badges cubicles and company posters are those of crew members.
tp
Employee photos and names seen at STARKE Pharmaceuticals , including those on ID badges , cubicles , and company posters , are those of crew members.
1850
After the first week record-breaking release of the first "Madea" film by Tyler Perry Lions Gate Entertainment acquired a seven-picture deal of the remaining Madea films.
tp
After the first week record - breaking release of the first "Madea" film by Tyler Perry , Lions Gate Entertainment acquired a seven - picture deal of the remaining Madea films.
1851
In the hotel scene with Scott Speedman and Maria Bello Scott sits with his shirt off. We see him wearing a gold necklace with a Broken Heart pendant hanging on it; it is the other half of Gwyneth's necklace the one she claims her father gave her on her 3rd birthday. This is never explained in the movie.
tp
In the hotel scene with Scott Speedman and Maria Bello , Scott sits with his shirt off. We see him wearing a gold necklace with a Broken Heart pendant hanging on it ; it is the other half of Gwyneth's necklace , the one she claims her father gave her on her 3rd birthday. This is never explained in the movie.
1852
Samantha's gown was from designer Elsie Katz couture collection.
tp
Samantha's gown was from designer Elsie Katz couture collection.
1853
The concept of "Annwn" (Annwyn) is not made up especially for the film or the book on which it was based. "Annwn" is an underworld or other world found in Welsh legend a land of the dead. It is said to lay far in the west and could be accessed by the living through a door located at the mouth of the Severn once a year. Surviving from pre-Christian Celtic mythology it's neither Heaven nor Hell in the Christian sense humans can enter spiritually or corporeally. This is the first film about Annwn.
fn
null

tp

Arranger Riley Hampton , who orchestrated all of Etta's Chess hits , including "At Last , " is not mentioned anywhere in the film.
1861
Michelle Rodriguez trained for two months before the 30-day shoot began. She was also chosen over 300 other women to be cast in the film. It was her first audition.
tp
Michelle Rodriguez trained for two months before the 30 - day shoot began. She was also chosen over 300 other women to be cast in the film. It was her first audition.
1862
Guy Pearce insisted on being filmed with an adult tiger. Usually these scenes are filmed separately.
tp
Guy Pearce insisted on being filmed with an adult tiger. Usually , these scenes are filmed separately.
1863
Winona Ryder was initially attached to this movie.
tp
Winona Ryder was initially attached to this movie.
1864
The plot of this movie has partly been anticipated by (or been plagiarized from) the first season episode The Moving Finger. In that episode Major Nelson works as technical consultant for a studio making a movie in which an American astronaut shrunken to the size of a pinhead is injected into the bloodstream of a Soviet astronaut works his way to the brain and retrieves information vital to the defense of the country.
tp
The plot of this movie has partly been anticipated by ( or been plagiarized from ) the first season episode The Moving Finger . In that episode , Major Nelson works as technical consultant for a studio making a movie , in which an American astronaut , shrunken to the size of a pinhead , is injected into the bloodstream of a Soviet astronaut , works his way to the brain and retrieves information vital to the defense of the country.
1865
Don Ameche's final film. He completed his scenes just before his death.
tp
Don Ameche 's final film. He completed his scenes just before his death.
1866
A photo is shown of Ms. Kraft (Bebe Neuwirth) with Broadway stage legend Chita Rivera. Rivera notably played the role of Velma Kelly in the original 1975 Broadway production of "Chicago". Neuwirth also played Velma Kelly when "Chicago" was revived on Broadway in 1996. Both actresses received Tony Award nominations for their portrayals of the same character. Neuwirth went on to win the honor.
tp
A photo is shown of Ms. Kraft ( Bebe Neuwirth ) with Broadway stage legend Chita Rivera . Rivera notably played the role of Velma Kelly in the original 1975 Broadway production of "Chicago". Neuwirth also played Velma Kelly when "Chicago" was revived on Broadway in 1996. Both actresses received Tony Award nominations for their portrayals of the same character. Neuwirth went on to win the honor.
1867
Goofs Anachronisms: There are numerous changes to the Seattle skyline since the time of the riots. 1) The Kingdome should be present but isn't 2) Qwest Field is shown but didn't exist at the time 3) The new City Hall is featured in a shot but it wasn't built yet 4) There are several changes to the downtown retail core and 5) Many buildings have been added and deleted from the Fourth Avenue scenes.

1871
The sorority Alpha Omega Pi is actually based on UC Berkeley's Alpha Omicron Pi sorority. The writer lived next door to their house when he went to college there.
tp
The sorority Alpha Omega Pi is actually based on UC Berkeley's Alpha Omicron Pi sorority. The writer lived next door to their house when he went to college there.
1872
William Shakespeare was both a playwright and an actor and is widely believed to have played the ghost of Hamlet's father in early productions. In this film the Ghost is played by Sam Shepard who is also both an actor and a playwright.
tp
William Shakespeare was both a playwright and an actor , and is widely believed to have played the ghost of Hamlet's father in early productions. In this film , the Ghost is played by Sam Shepard , who is also both an actor and a playwright.
1873
Before she dies Julia is seen waitressing at "The Purple Onion" a real San Francisco club where comedians such as Phyllis Diller and the Smothers Brothers (Dick Smothers and Tom Smothers) performed. When Julia's boyfriend shows up the comedian on stage is dressed like and performing one of the monologues of Bob Newhart because he is Newhart's son.
tp
Before she dies , Julia is seen waitressing at "The Purple Onion" , a real San Francisco club where comedians such as Phyllis Diller and the Smothers Brothers ( Dick Smothers and Tom Smothers ) performed. When Julia's boyfriend shows up , the comedian on stage is dressed like , and performing one of the monologues of , Bob Newhart , because he is Newhart's son.

1875
In this movie Paul Dano plays the older brother of Pell James' character. James is actually seven years older than Dano in real life.

null
1876
According to an interview with Jeb Stuart in Premiere magazine he had originally intended to make this movie back in the early 1980's under the title 'Going West in America' with Sidney Poitier Robert Duvall and Kevin Bacon in the three main roles.
tp
According to an interview with Jeb Stuart in Premiere magazine , he had originally intended to make this movie back in the early 1980's under the title 'Going West in America' , with Sidney Poitier , Robert Duvall , and Kevin Bacon in the three main roles.
1877
The Shetland pony Tucker (Dustin Hoffman) had to be painted brown during filming because his real coat turned gray. Everyone was so surprised but the animal trainers did a little touch-up with brown dye.
tp
The Shetland pony , Tucker ( Dustin Hoffman ), had to be painted brown during filming because his real coat turned gray. Everyone was so surprised , but the animal trainers did a little touch - up with brown dye.
1878
The toy store in the movie in reality is a bookstore on the Main Street in Clinton New Jersey USA. There is a toy store on Main Street but it is in an alley and director Robert Butler didn't like the exterior of the building. The bookstore's front window was decorated with toys for the week of filming.
tp
The toy store in the movie in reality is a bookstore on the Main Street in Clinton , New Jersey , USA. There is a toy store on Main Street but it is in an alley and director Robert Butler didn't like the exterior of the building. The bookstore's front window was decorated with toys for the week of filming.
1879
Michelle Williams did not shave her legs or clean her fingernails during filming. After filming completed Williams' friend Busy Philipps treated her to a manicure and pedicure.

Outside of the six main characters no one else plays a role in the film.

Those are real local Boston actors and members of the local populace in all the backgrounds. Ben Affleck made a deliberate choice not to cast professional extras for authenticity.

1895
There are several shots in the movie showing a worn movie marquee advertising a film called "See You Next n sday." The inclusion of the phrase "See you next Wednesday" is a trademark of director John Landis (he has incorporated it into nearly all of the movies and many of the music videos he has directed). Landis in turn took the line from the movie 2001: A Space Odyssey.
tp
There are several shots in the movie showing a worn movie marquee advertising a film called "See You Next n sday." The inclusion of the phrase "See you next Wednesday" is a trademark of director John Landis ( he has incorporated it into nearly all of the movies and many of the music videos he has directed ) . Landis , in turn , took the line from the movie 2001 : A Space Odyssey .
1896
Cameo: [Ben Campbell] the real life Ben Campbell as a Planet Hollywood blackjack dealer.
tp
Cameo : [ Ben Campbell ] the real life Ben Campbell as a Planet Hollywood blackjack dealer.
1897
Multiple identical puppets had to be created so that more scenes could be accomplished in a shorter period of time. In all fourteen puppets of the Bride and Victor were created and thirteen were created of Victoria.
tp
Multiple , identical puppets had to be created so that more scenes could be accomplished in a shorter period of time. In all , fourteen puppets of the Bride and Victor were created , and thirteen were created of Victoria.
1898
Many of the news reports spread throughout the movie are actual weathermen from Oklahoma news stations including Gary England chief meteorologist at KWTV in Oklahoma City and Rick Mitchell chief meteorologist at KOCO in Oklahoma City. The "1969" footage of Gary England giving the televised tornado warning to Jo's family is actual archived footage of him issuing a tornado warning; however Gary England did not join KWTV until 1972.
tp
Many of the news reports spread throughout the movie are actual weathermen from Oklahoma news stations , including Gary England , chief meteorologist at KWTV in Oklahoma City , and Rick Mitchell , chief meteorologist at KOCO in Oklahoma City. The "1969" footage of Gary England giving the televised tornado warning to Jo's family is actual archived footage of him issuing a tornado warning ; however , Gary England did not join KWTV until 1972.
1899
Prop master Jim Murray coated the pigs used in the judge's trap with honey and attempted to stick live maggots on them for close-up shots as requested by director Darren Lynn Bousman.
tp
Prop master Jim Murray coated the pigs used in the judge's trap with honey and attempted to stick live maggots on them for close - up shots , as requested by director Darren Lynn Bousman .
1900
Harrison Ford told Gary Oldman to actually hit him during the filming of the fight scenes.

1901
The white convertible in the movie is a 1969 Camaro RS/SS Indy 500 Pace Car one of only 3675 made.
tp
The white convertible in the movie is a 1969 Camaro RS / SS Indy 500 Pace Car one of only 3 , 675 made.
1902
During the KY Jelly wrestling scene the two female wrestlers are announced as residents of Hayden Hall. In reality Hayden Hall is a dorm at director Todd Phillips's alma mater New York University.
tp
During the KY Jelly wrestling scene the two female wrestlers are announced as residents of Hayden Hall. In reality , Hayden Hall is a dorm at director Todd Phillips 's alma mater , New York University.
1903
In one scene the Gingerbread Man's life essentially passes before his eyes. Not only does this scene make reference to The Six Million Dollar Man but according to the sequence the Gingerbread Man is or was married.
fn
null
1904
In the Booth diary the remaining part of the page after the words Thomas Gates Artifex (artifex: Latin) adj. skilled masterful) is the word Aenigmatum or enigma. The Latin word and Greek word brought together mean one who is skilled in puzzles.
tp
In the Booth diary the remaining part of the page after the words Thomas Gates Artifex ( artifex : Latin ) adj. , skilled , masterful ) is the word Aenigmatum , or enigma. The Latin word and Greek word brought together mean one who is skilled in puzzles.
1905
The film's director Tony Gilroy grew up about 65 miles north of New York City in Orange County New York and did not forget where he came from in his directorial debut. It is mentioned that Michael Clayton attended Washingtonville Central High School; graduating in 1977. Gilroy himself graduated from Washingtonville High School in 1974. The home of Michael Clayton depicted in the film is actually in Blooming Grove NY. The airport where Michael boards a private jet was filmed at Stewart International Airport in New Windsor/Newburgh NY. And the pivotal moment of the film involving an incident with a main character's automobile was filmed at the Moodna Viaduct in Salisbury Mills NY. All of these locales are within 7 miles of his hometown.
tp
The film's director Tony Gilroy grew up about 65 miles north of New York City in Orange County , New York and did not forget where he came from in his directorial debut. It is mentioned that Michael Clayton attended Washingtonville Central High School ; graduating in 1977. Gilroy , himself , graduated from Washingtonville High School in 1974. The home of Michael Clayton depicted in the film is actually in Blooming Grove , NY. The airport where Michael boards a private jet was filmed at Stewart International Airport in New Windsor / Newburgh , NY. And the pivotal moment of the film involving an incident with a main character's automobile was filmed at the Moodna Viaduct in Salisbury Mills , NY. All of these locales are within 7 miles of his hometown.
1906
It took Alex Proyas three months to shoot the film about half the time it took to shoot I Robot. He credits the use of digital technology for being able to shoot so quickly and efficiently.
tp
It took Alex Proyas three months to shoot the film , about half the time it took to shoot I , Robot . He credits the use of digital technology for being able to shoot so quickly and efficiently.
1907
The name of the dog that wins the race is "Bahama Mamma".
tp
The name of the dog that wins the race is "Bahama Mamma".

tp

1913
In the scene where we see the nurse doing a crossword she circles the word "INNOCENT" (which is back to front). Innocence is a major element in Ginger Snaps: Unleashed. For example; Tyler was innocent when Brigitte put him out with the wolf. Brigitte was innocent when she was put into the rehab clinic; and also when she was confronted after Ghost's dog was decapitated. It has not been confirmed whether this was intentional or not.
tp
In the scene where we see the nurse doing a crossword , she circles the word "INNOCENT" ( which is back to front ) . Innocence is a major element in Ginger Snaps : Unleashed. For example ; Tyler was innocent when Brigitte put him out with the wolf. Brigitte was innocent when she was put into the rehab clinic ; and also when she was confronted after Ghost's dog was decapitated. It has not been confirmed whether this was intentional or not.

The first mainstream English language film with unsimulated sex scenes to be passed uncut in Great Britain.

During filming animal rights activists showed up with the intention to make sure all the fish were treated correctly. After viewing the script and realizing that the title of the film was really more about cheating 'fish' that actually shooting it they left somewhat embarrassed.
tp
During filming , animal rights activists showed up with the intention to make sure all the fish were treated correctly. After viewing the script , and realizing that the title of the film was really more about cheating 'fish' that actually shooting it , they left somewhat embarrassed.

The opening prologue states: "The following account is based on actual events during World War II when 61000 Allied POWs were forced to build the Thailand-Burma Railway."

null
1925
Director Larry Clark didn't believe that Vincent Kartheiser then 18 was of a legal age for his role (involving nudity sexual situations and drug use) and wouldn't cast him until he was able to prove his age. Kartheiser was cast once he produced his driver's license.
tp
Director Larry Clark didn't believe that Vincent Kartheiser , then 18 , was of a legal age for his role ( involving nudity , sexual situations , and drug use ) and wouldn't cast him until he was able to prove his age. Kartheiser was cast once he produced his driver's license.
1926
By the time New Line had agreed to finance the film several other studios had similar nativity scripts under review so the film was rushed to production for a Christmas 2006 release date thereby eliminating competition.
tp
By the time New Line had agreed to finance the film , several other studios had similar nativity scripts under review , so the film was rushed to production for a Christmas 2006 release date , thereby eliminating competition.
1927
A 90%/scale reproduction of the Auschwitz/Birkenau death camp was constructed near Sofia Bulgaria for the shooting of this film. The actual plans for the original Auschwitz camp were used to build the set.
tp
A 90% / scale reproduction of the Auschwitz / Birkenau death camp was constructed near Sofia , Bulgaria , for the shooting of this film. The actual plans for the original Auschwitz camp were used to build the set.

1931
Hayao Miyazaki first wrote author Ursula K. Le Guin about adapting her book into a film. LeGuin at the time was unfamiliar with Miyazaki's work and associated animation to be similar to Disney animation and turned the offer down. After she saw My Neighbor Totoro she loved it and decided to allow the movie to be made.

Filmed in summer 2007 one of the rainiest summers on record in England. The crew suffered rainfall at nearly every location and even had to contend with rain while on location in Venice.

1949
Because of phonetic differences between English and Korean both "Mother" and "Murder" are spelled the same when translated to Korean characters. The movie title "Madeo" is a play on this similarity suggesting both "Mother" and "Murder".

1973
In the scene where they are teeing off at the 'golf course' they are actually standing on the lawn in front of the Mansion House in Baltimore's Druid Hill Park. The Mansion House is the current day administrative offices for the Baltimore Zoo. There is no real golf course in Druid Hill Park.
tp
In the scene where they are teeing off at the 'golf course' , they are actually standing on the lawn in front of the Mansion House in Baltimore's Druid Hill Park. The Mansion House is the current day administrative offices for the Baltimore Zoo. There is no real golf course in Druid Hill Park.
